<span id = "number">345</span><title>詠</title>	<p>Listening to the words of poets reciting their poetry is like being transported for a moment into eternity where the rules of everyday life have been suspended。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/詠 えい">エイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/詠 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/詠 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/詠 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/詠よ－む">詠よ－む</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/詠">詠</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/詠">詠</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/詠">詠</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/詠">詠</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/詠">詠</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/詠">詠</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/詠">詠</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/詠">詠</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/詠">詠</a>
<span id = "number">346</span><title>詩</title>	<p>Since silence is treasured so highly at a Buddhist temple the words spoken there must be well chosen。 Perhaps this is why the records of the monks often read to us like poems。 Before going on、 back up a frame and make sure you have kept poem and re...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/詩 し">シ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/詩 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/詩 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/詩 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/詩">詩</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/詩">詩</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/詩">詩</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/詩">詩</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/詩">詩</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/詩">詩</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/詩">詩</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/詩">詩</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/詩">詩</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/詩">詩</a>
<span id = "number">347</span><title>語</title>	<p>Whereas the character for say focused on the actual talking、 the kanji for words stresses the fact that although it is I who say them、 the words of a language are not my own。 You can see the clear distinction between I and words just by looking at ...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/語 ご">ゴ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/語 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/語 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/語 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/語かた－る">語かた－る</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/語かた－らう">語かた－らう</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/語">語</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/語">語</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/語">語</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/語">語</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/語">語</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/語">語</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/語">語</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/語">語</a>
<span id = "number">348</span><title>読</title>	<p>In the age of advertising、 most words we read are out to sell some product or point of view。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/読 どく">ドク</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/読 とく">トク</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/読 とう">トウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/読 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/読よ－む">読よ－む</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/読">読</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/読">読</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/読">読</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/読">読</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/読">読</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/読">読</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/読">読</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/読">読</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/読">読</a>
<span id = "number">349</span><title>調</title>	<p>A complete tune is composed not only of a succession of notes but also of one lap of the words that go with it。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/調 ちょう">チョウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/調 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/調 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/調 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/調しら－べる">調しら－べる</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/調ととの－う">調ととの－う</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/調ととの－える">調ととの－える</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/調">調</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/調">調</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/調">調</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/調">調</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/調">調</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/調">調</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/調">調</a>
<span id = "number">350</span><title>談</title>	<p>In almost every attempt to discuss an issue、 the fervor of one’s convictions comes to the surface and creates an inflammation of words （if you will、 the “cuss” in discuss）。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/談 だん">ダン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/談 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/談 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/談 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/談">談</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/談">談</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/談">談</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/談">談</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/談">談</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/談">談</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/談">談</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/談">談</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/談">談</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/談">談</a>
<span id = "number">351</span><title>諾</title>	<p>The words of the young do not have legal validity unless backed up by “parental consent。”</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/諾 だく">ダク</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/諾 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/諾 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/諾 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/諾">諾</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/諾">諾</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/諾">諾</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/諾">諾</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/諾">諾</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/諾">諾</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/諾">諾</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/諾">諾</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/諾">諾</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/諾">諾</a>
<span id = "number">352</span><title>諭</title>	<p>The stern tone of a rebuke is seen here in the image of words spoken at a meeting of butchers （see frame 289 輸） waving their choppers at one another and “cutting one another down” as only butchers can。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/諭 ゆ">ユ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/諭 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/諭 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/諭 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/諭さと－す">諭さと－す</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/諭">諭</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/諭">諭</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/諭">諭</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/諭">諭</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/諭">諭</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/諭">諭</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/諭">諭</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/諭">諭</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/諭">諭</a>
<span id = "number">353</span><title>式</title>	<p>Take style in its sense of some fashion design or model。 Then let the element arrow and craft stand for the well－known style of shirts known as “Arrow shirts” because of the little arrow sewn on each one。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/式 しき">シキ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/式 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/式 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/式 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/式">式</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/式">式</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/式">式</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/式">式</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/式">式</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/式">式</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/式">式</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/式">式</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/式">式</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/式">式</a>
<span id = "number">354</span><title>試</title>	<p>When a manufacturer produces a new style for the market、 the first thing that is done is to run a test on consumers、 asking them to speak their opinions frankly about the product。 Never mind the anachronism （the kanji was there well before our ca...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/試 し">シ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/試 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/試 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/試 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/試こころ－みる">試こころ－みる</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/試ため－す">試ため－す</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/試">試</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/試">試</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/試">試</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/試">試</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/試">試</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/試">試</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/試">試</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/試">試</a>
<span id = "number">355</span><title>弐</title>	<p> We use the Roman numeral ii here to stress that this kanji is an older form of the kanji for two。 Think of two arrows in a quiver、 standing up like the numeral ii。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/弐 に">ニ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/弐 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/弐 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/弐 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/弐">弐</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/弐">弐</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/弐">弐</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/弐">弐</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/弐">弐</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/弐">弐</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/弐">弐</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/弐">弐</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/弐">弐</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/弐">弐</a>
<span id = "number">356</span><title>域</title>	<p>From its original meaning of a defined area or zone、 a range has also come to mean a grazing land where cowboys roam and do whatever it is they do with cows。 When the herds have all been driven to market、 there is a great homecoming fiesta like tha...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/域 いき">イキ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/域 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/域 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/域 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/域">域</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/域">域</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/域">域</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/域">域</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/域">域</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/域">域</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/域">域</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/域">域</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/域">域</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/域">域</a>
<span id = "number">357</span><title>賊</title>	<p>From a burglar’s point of view、 a fiesta is an occasion to take out the old lockpicking needle and break into the unattended safe filled with the family shells （the old form of money、 as we saw in frames 80 and 194）。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/賊 ぞく">ゾク</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/賊 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/賊 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/賊 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/賊">賊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/賊">賊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/賊">賊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/賊">賊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/賊">賊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/賊">賊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/賊">賊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/賊">賊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/賊">賊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/賊">賊</a>
<span id = "number">358</span><title>栽</title>	<p>On a fruit plantation it is the trees that one is particularly grateful for at the time of Thanksgiving。 Imagine yourself inviting a few representative trees from the fields and orchards to join you around the table to give thanks。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/栽 さい">サイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/栽 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/栽 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/栽 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/栽">栽</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/栽">栽</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/栽">栽</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/栽">栽</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/栽">栽</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/栽">栽</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/栽">栽</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/栽">栽</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/栽">栽</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/栽">栽</a>
<span id = "number">359</span><title>載</title>	<p>One loads bales on a wagon or cart in preparation for the great Hay Ride that follows the Thanksgiving dinner each year。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/載 さい">サイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/載 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/載 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/載 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/載の－せる">載の－せる</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/載の－る">載の－る</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/載">載</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/載">載</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/載">載</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/載">載</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/載">載</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/載">載</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/載">載</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/載">載</a>
<span id = "number">360</span><title>茂</title>	<p>The sense of the key word overgrown is of something growing luxuriously、 though not necessarily in excess—in this case a whole parade of weeds （outcaste flowers）。 By way of exception、 the flowers take their normal place over the enclosure。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/茂 も">モ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/茂 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/茂 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/茂 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/茂しげ－る">茂しげ－る</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/茂">茂</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/茂">茂</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/茂">茂</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/茂">茂</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/茂">茂</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/茂">茂</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/茂">茂</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/茂">茂</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/茂">茂</a>
<span id = "number">361</span><title>成</title>	<p>Let the phrase “turn into” suggest some sort of a magical change。 What happens here is that the parade marching down main street turns into a dagger－throwing bout between competing bands。 Note how only one stroke has to be added to make the cha...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/成 せい">セイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/成 じょう">ジョウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/成 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/成 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/成な－る">成な－る</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/成な－す">成な－す</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/成">成</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/成">成</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/成">成</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/成">成</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/成">成</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/成">成</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/成">成</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/成">成</a>
<span id = "number">362</span><title>城</title>	<p>In this frame、 we see a mound of dirt that is being turned into a castle （the way you may have done as a child playing on the beach）。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/城 じょう">ジョウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/城 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/城 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/城 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/城しろ">城しろ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/城">城</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/城">城</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/城">城</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/城">城</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/城">城</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/城">城</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/城">城</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/城">城</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/城">城</a>
<span id = "number">363</span><title>誠</title>	<p>The sure sign of sincerity is that one’s mere words are turned into deeds。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/誠 せい">セイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/誠 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/誠 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/誠 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/誠まこと">誠まこと</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/誠">誠</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/誠">誠</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/誠">誠</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/誠">誠</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/誠">誠</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/誠">誠</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/誠">誠</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/誠">誠</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/誠">誠</a>
<span id = "number">364</span><title>威</title>	<p>Here we see a march of women demonstrating on behalf of equal rights、 something extremely intimidating to the male chauvinist population。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/威 い">イ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/威 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/威 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/威 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/威">威</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/威">威</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/威">威</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/威">威</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/威">威</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/威">威</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/威">威</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/威">威</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/威">威</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/威">威</a>
<span id = "number">365</span><title>滅</title>	<p>Picture a march of flames demonstrating against the Fire Department for their right to destroy、 but being doused with water by the police riot squads。 </p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滅 めつ">メツ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滅 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滅 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滅 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滅ほろ－びる">滅ほろ－びる</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滅ほろ－ぼす">滅ほろ－ぼす</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滅">滅</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滅">滅</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滅">滅</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滅">滅</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滅">滅</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滅">滅</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滅">滅</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滅">滅</a>
<span id = "number">366</span><title>減</title>	<p>A group of unquenchable mouths sets out on a march across the country、 drinking water wherever they can find it until the water supply has dwindled to a trickle、 triggering a national disaster。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/減 げん">ゲン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/減 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/減 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/減 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/減へ－る">減へ－る</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/減へ－らす">減へ－らす</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/減">減</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/減">減</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/減">減</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/減">減</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/減">減</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/減">減</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/減">減</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/減">減</a>
<span id = "number">367</span><title>桟</title>	<p>Prior to the use of metal、 trees were once cut down and bound together for use as scaff olding material。 In the case of the kanji shown here、 what is being constructed is not a skyscraper but a simple float。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/桟 さん">サン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/桟 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/桟 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/桟 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/桟">桟</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/桟">桟</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/桟">桟</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/桟">桟</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/桟">桟</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/桟">桟</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/桟">桟</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/桟">桟</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/桟">桟</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/桟">桟</a>
<span id = "number">368</span><title>銭</title>	<p>Those special gold－colored tokens minted each year for the Mardi Gras and thrown into the crowds from people on the floats give us the kanji for coins。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/銭 せん">セン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/銭 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/銭 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/銭 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/銭ぜに">銭ぜに</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/銭">銭</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/銭">銭</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/銭">銭</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/銭">銭</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/銭">銭</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/銭">銭</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/銭">銭</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/銭">銭</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/銭">銭</a>
<span id = "number">369</span><title>浅</title>	<p>An entourage of floats going from one town to the next must always seek a shallow place to cross the water。 Try to picture what happens if they don’t。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/浅 せん">セン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/浅 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/浅 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/浅 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/浅あさ－い">浅あさ－い</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/浅">浅</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/浅">浅</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/浅">浅</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/浅">浅</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/浅">浅</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/浅">浅</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/浅">浅</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/浅">浅</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/浅">浅</a>
<span id = "number">370</span><title>止</title>	<p>The character for stop is easiest to learn as a pictograph、 though you have to take a moment to see it。 Take it as a rather crude drawing of a footprint： the first 3 strokes represent the front of the foot and the last the heel。 The big toe （st...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/止 し">シ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/止 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/止 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/止 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/止と－まる">止と－まる</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/止と－める">止と－める</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/止">止</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/止">止</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/止">止</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/止">止</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/止">止</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/止">止</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/止">止</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/止">止</a>
<span id = "number">371</span><title>歩</title>	<p>Footprints that follow one another a few at a time indicate walking。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歩 ほ">ホ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歩 ぶ">ブ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歩 ふ">フ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歩 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歩ある－く">歩ある－く</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歩あゆ－む">歩あゆ－む</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歩">歩</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歩">歩</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歩">歩</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歩">歩</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歩">歩</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歩">歩</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歩">歩</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歩">歩</a>
<span id = "number">372</span><title>渉</title>	<p>To ford a body of water means to walk across it。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/渉 しょう">ショウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/渉 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/渉 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/渉 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/渉">渉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/渉">渉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/渉">渉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/渉">渉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/渉">渉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/渉">渉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/渉">渉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/渉">渉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/渉">渉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/渉">渉</a>
<span id = "number">373</span><title>頻</title>	<p>The image of something occurring repeatedly、 over and over again、 is of having one’s head walked on。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/頻 ひん">ヒン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/頻 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/頻 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/頻 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/頻">頻</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/頻">頻</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/頻">頻</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/頻">頻</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/頻">頻</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/頻">頻</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/頻">頻</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/頻">頻</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/頻">頻</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/頻">頻</a>
<span id = "number">374</span><title>肯</title>	<p>Seeing footprints on someone’s flesh indicates a rather brutal way of having secured that person’s agreement。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肯 こう">コウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肯 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肯 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肯 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肯">肯</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肯">肯</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肯">肯</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肯">肯</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肯">肯</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肯">肯</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肯">肯</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肯">肯</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肯">肯</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肯">肯</a>
<span id = "number">375</span><title>企</title>	<p>To undertake a project is to take some idea floating in the air and stop it so that it can be brought down to earth and become a reality。 Here we see some undertaking made to stop under a beach umbrella。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/企 き">キ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/企 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/企 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/企 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/企くわだ－てる">企くわだ－てる</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/企">企</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/企">企</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/企">企</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/企">企</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/企">企</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/企">企</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/企">企</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/企">企</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/企">企</a>
<span id = "number">376</span><title>歴</title>	<p>That same grove of trees we met in frame 213 暦 shows up here in the character for curriculum （in the sense of a record of one’s life or academic achievements、 the curriculum vitae）。 Instead of the grove making its way slowly through the surfa...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歴 れき">レキ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歴 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歴 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歴 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歴">歴</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歴">歴</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歴">歴</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歴">歴</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歴">歴</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歴">歴</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歴">歴</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歴">歴</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歴">歴</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歴">歴</a>
<span id = "number">377</span><title>武</title>	<p>With a quiver of arrows set on one’s back、 the goal of the warrior depicted here is not to attack but merely to stop the attack of others： the oldest excuse in history！</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/武 ぶ">ブ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/武 む">ム</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/武 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/武 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/武">武</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/武">武</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/武">武</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/武">武</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/武">武</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/武">武</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/武">武</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/武">武</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/武">武</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/武">武</a>
<span id = "number">378</span><title>賦</title>	<p>A certain portion of shells （money） is collected by the warrior from the local villages as he passes through to defray the costs of keeping the land safe、 and this is called a levy。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/賦 ふ">フ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/賦 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/賦 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/賦 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/賦">賦</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/賦">賦</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/賦">賦</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/賦">賦</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/賦">賦</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/賦">賦</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/賦">賦</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/賦">賦</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/賦">賦</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/賦">賦</a>
<span id = "number">379</span><title>正</title>	<p>“A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step、” says the Chinese proverb。 Here we see one footprint、 complementing that proverb with the sound advice that if the first step is not made correctly、 the whole point of the journey will...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/正 せい">セイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/正 しょう">ショウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/正 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/正 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/正ただ－しい">正ただ－しい</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/正ただ－す">正ただ－す</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/正まさ">正まさ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/正">正</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/正">正</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/正">正</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/正">正</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/正">正</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/正">正</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/正">正</a>
<span id = "number">380</span><title>証</title>	<p>Words that testify to the correctness of some fact are classified as evidence。 （Here we see a good example of how the more common primitive element takes the “strong” position to the left 、 even though it has more strokes。）</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/証 しょう">ショウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/証 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/証 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/証 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/証">証</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/証">証</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/証">証</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/証">証</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/証">証</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/証">証</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/証">証</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/証">証</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/証">証</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/証">証</a>
<span id = "number">381</span><title>政</title>	<p>To the many definitions for politics that already exist、 this character off ers yet another： correct taskmastering。 Think about what</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/政 せい">セイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/政 しょう">ショウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/政 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/政 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/政まつりごと">政まつりごと</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/政">政</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/政">政</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/政">政</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/政">政</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/政">政</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/政">政</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/政">政</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/政">政</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/政">政</a>
<span id = "number">382</span><title>定</title>	<p>Determination、 in the sense of settling on a certain course of action、 is likened here to mending one’s house。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/定 てい">テイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/定 じょう">ジョウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/定 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/定 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/定さだ－める">定さだ－める</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/定さだ－まる">定さだ－まる</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/定さだ－か">定さだ－か</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/定">定</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/定">定</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/定">定</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/定">定</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/定">定</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/定">定</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/定">定</a>
<span id = "number">383</span><title>錠</title>	<p>Metal of itself doesn’t lock。 It needs to be so determined by a locksmith。 Now make a concrete image of that。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/錠 じょう">ジョウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/錠 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/錠 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/錠 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/錠">錠</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/錠">錠</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/錠">錠</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/錠">錠</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/錠">錠</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/錠">錠</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/錠">錠</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/錠">錠</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/錠">錠</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/錠">錠</a>
<span id = "number">384</span><title>走</title>	<p>Running、 we are told here、 mends the soil。 Observe in the following frames how this kanji can embrace other elements from below、 much the same way as the element for road does。 Note、 too、 that in order to do this、 the final stroke needs t...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/走 そう">ソウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/走 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/走 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/走 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/走はし－る">走はし－る</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/走">走</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/走">走</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/走">走</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/走">走</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/走">走</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/走">走</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/走">走</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/走">走</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/走">走</a>
<span id = "number">385</span><title>超</title>	<p>When one is running after something、 the goal that seduces one is said to transcend the seeker。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/超 ちょう">チョウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/超 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/超 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/超 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/超こ－える">超こ－える</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/超こ－す">超こ－す</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/超">超</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/超">超</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/超">超</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/超">超</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/超">超</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/超">超</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/超">超</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/超">超</a>
<span id = "number">386</span><title>赴</title>	<p>In proceeding to a new city or a new job、 something in you runs ahead with excitement、 and something else holds you back、 like a divining rod built into your psyche warning you to check things out carefully before rushing in too wildly。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/赴 ふ">フ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/赴 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/赴 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/赴 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/赴おもむ－く">赴おもむ－く</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/赴">赴</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/赴">赴</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/赴">赴</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/赴">赴</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/赴">赴</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/赴">赴</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/赴">赴</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/赴">赴</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/赴">赴</a>
<span id = "number">387</span><title>越</title>	<p>Here we see two parades in competition、 each trying to surpass the other by running at high speed from one town to the next。 Note the little “hook” at the end of the first stroke of the element for parade。 This is the only time it appears like ...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/越 えつ">エツ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/越 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/越 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/越 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/越こ－す">越こ－す</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/越こ－える">越こ－える</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/越">越</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/越">越</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/越">越</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/越">越</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/越">越</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/越">越</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/越">越</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/越">越</a>
<span id = "number">388</span><title>是</title>	<p>In this kanji we are shown someone spending an entire day at mending one stocking、 because they want the job done “just so。” Be sure to make a clear image of a finicky old fusspot to make the abstract idea as concrete as possible。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/是 ぜ">ゼ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/是 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/是 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/是 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/是">是</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/是">是</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/是">是</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/是">是</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/是">是</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/是">是</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/是">是</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/是">是</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/是">是</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/是">是</a>
<span id = "number">389</span><title>題</title>	<p>In many kinds of research、 one can find information on a given topic only if the headings are prepared just so。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/題 だい">ダイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/題 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/題 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/題 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/題">題</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/題">題</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/題">題</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/題">題</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/題">題</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/題">題</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/題">題</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/題">題</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/題">題</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/題">題</a>
<span id = "number">390</span><title>堤</title>	<p>A dike is a successful bit of engineering only if the amount of earth piled up is measured just so for the height and pressure of the water it is meant to contain。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/堤 てい">テイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/堤 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/堤 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/堤 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/堤つつみ">堤つつみ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/堤">堤</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/堤">堤</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/堤">堤</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/堤">堤</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/堤">堤</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/堤">堤</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/堤">堤</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/堤">堤</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/堤">堤</a>
<span id = "number">391</span><title>建</title>	<p>To construct a building、 you first draw a set of plans （the writing brush） and then s－t－r－e－t－c－h your drawing out to scale in reality。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/建 けん">ケン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/建 こん">コン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/建 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/建 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/建た－てる">建た－てる</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/建た－つ">建た－つ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/建">建</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/建">建</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/建">建</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/建">建</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/建">建</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/建">建</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/建">建</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/建">建</a>
<span id = "number">392</span><title>延</title>	<p>This character is a kind of pictographic image of how prolonging is a clever way of stopping things by trying to stretch them out a little bit at a time （the extra drop at the top of stop）。 Be sure to get a concrete image of this process、 by imag...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/延 えん">エン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/延 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/延 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/延 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/延の－びる">延の－びる</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/延の－べる">延の－べる</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/延の－ばす">延の－ばす</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/延">延</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/延">延</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/延">延</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/延">延</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/延">延</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/延">延</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/延">延</a>
<span id = "number">393</span><title>誕</title>	<p>The key word of course calls to mind the feast of Christmas。 As the famous poem at the start of St。 John’s gospel tells us、 the nativity we celebrate at Christmas had its origins at the very start of time and governs all of human history： it re...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/誕 たん">タン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/誕 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/誕 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/誕 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/誕">誕</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/誕">誕</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/誕">誕</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/誕">誕</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/誕">誕</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/誕">誕</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/誕">誕</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/誕">誕</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/誕">誕</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/誕">誕</a>
<span id = "number">394</span><title>礎</title>	<p>This character depicts a cornerstone as a stone set at the end of a wildlife preserve （the “zoo in the grove”）。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/礎 そ">ソ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/礎 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/礎 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/礎 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/礎いしずえ">礎いしずえ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/礎">礎</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/礎">礎</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/礎">礎</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/礎">礎</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/礎">礎</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/礎">礎</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/礎">礎</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/礎">礎</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/礎">礎</a>
<span id = "number">395</span><title>婿</title>	<p>What makes a man a bridegroom is obviously a woman and her dowry、 here presented as a small zoo （animals were often used for this purpose in earlier societies） and a month away from it all （the “honeymoon”）。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/婿 せい">セイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/婿 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/婿 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/婿 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/婿むこ">婿むこ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/婿">婿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/婿">婿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/婿">婿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/婿">婿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/婿">婿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/婿">婿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/婿">婿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/婿">婿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/婿">婿</a>
<span id = "number">396</span><title>衣</title>	<p>At the top we see the top hat、 and at the bottom a pictographic representation of the folds of a garment。 If you break the “4－fold” fold into 2 sets of 2 strokes、 you will find it easier to remember。  Used as a primitive、 the additional m...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衣 い">イ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衣 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衣 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衣 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衣ころも">衣ころも</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衣">衣</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衣">衣</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衣">衣</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衣">衣</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衣">衣</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衣">衣</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衣">衣</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衣">衣</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衣">衣</a>
<span id = "number">397</span><title>裁</title>	<p>You might think here of garments that have been specially tailored for Thanks giving celebrations to look like traditional Pilgrim garb。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/裁 さい">サイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/裁 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/裁 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/裁 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/裁た－つ">裁た－つ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/裁さば－く">裁さば－く</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/裁">裁</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/裁">裁</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/裁">裁</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/裁">裁</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/裁">裁</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/裁">裁</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/裁">裁</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/裁">裁</a>
<span id = "number">398</span><title>装</title>	<p>The character for attire can be remembered as a picture of what we may call a “turtle－samurai” sweater。 At the top we see the turtle－samurai and at the bottom the element for garment。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/装 そう">ソウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/装 しょう">ショウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/装 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/装 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/装よそお－う">装よそお－う</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/装">装</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/装">装</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/装">装</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/装">装</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/装">装</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/装">装</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/装">装</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/装">装</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/装">装</a>
<span id = "number">399</span><title>裏</title>	<p>An innocent looking top hat and scarf lying there in front of you、 turned over、 reveal a hidden computer sewn into the back of each—obviously the tools of a master spy。 Such experiences teach one always to have a look at the back side of things。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/裏 り">リ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/裏 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/裏 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/裏 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/裏うら">裏うら</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/裏">裏</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/裏">裏</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/裏">裏</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/裏">裏</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/裏">裏</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/裏">裏</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/裏">裏</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/裏">裏</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/裏">裏</a>
<span id = "number">400</span><title>壊</title>	<p>The right half of this character shows a garment woven so fine that it can pass through the eye of a needle、 fittingly draped around the slithering、 ethereal form of a poltergeist。 In this frame、 our eerie visitor brushes its robes against a near...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/壊 かい">カイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/壊 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/壊 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/壊 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/壊こわ－す">壊こわ－す</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/壊こわ－れる">壊こわ－れる</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/壊">壊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/壊">壊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/壊">壊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/壊">壊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/壊">壊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/壊">壊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/壊">壊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/壊">壊</a>
<span id = "number">401</span><title>哀</title>	<p>A drunken sod in a tattered top hat and soiled silk scarf with a giant mouth guzzling something or other gives us a pathetic character role in which W。 C。 Fields might find himself right at home。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/哀 あい">アイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/哀 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/哀 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/哀 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/哀あわ－れ">哀あわ－れ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/哀あわ－れむ">哀あわ－れむ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/哀">哀</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/哀">哀</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/哀">哀</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/哀">哀</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/哀">哀</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/哀">哀</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/哀">哀</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/哀">哀</a>
<span id = "number">402</span><title>遠</title>	<p>A distant figure on the road is such a blur it looks like a lidded crock wearing a silk scarf。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遠 えん">エン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遠 おん">オン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遠 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遠 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遠とお－い">遠とお－い</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遠">遠</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遠">遠</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遠">遠</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遠">遠</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遠">遠</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遠">遠</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遠">遠</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遠">遠</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遠">遠</a>
<span id = "number">403</span><title>猿</title>	<p>This clever little monkey has captured an entire pack of wild dogs、 locked them inside a lidded crock、 and wrapped the whole thing up in a silk scarf to present to the dogcatcher。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/猿 えん">エン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/猿 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/猿 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/猿 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/猿さる">猿さる</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/猿">猿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/猿">猿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/猿">猿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/猿">猿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/猿">猿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/猿">猿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/猿">猿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/猿">猿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/猿">猿</a>
<span id = "number">404</span><title>初</title>	<p>The primitives here take care of themselves： cloak and dagger。 What I leave to you is to decide on an appropriate connotation for “first time” to take advantage of them。 氿</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/初 しょ">ショ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/初 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/初 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/初 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/初はじ－め">初はじ－め</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/初はじ－めて">初はじ－めて</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/初はつ">初はつ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/初うい">初うい</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/初そ－める">初そ－める</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/初">初</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/初">初</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/初">初</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/初">初</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/初">初</a>
<span id = "number">405</span><title>布</title>	<p>The maid、 towels by her side、 distributes the linen。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/布 ふ">フ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/布 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/布 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/布 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/布ぬの">布ぬの</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/布">布</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/布">布</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/布">布</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/布">布</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/布">布</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/布">布</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/布">布</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/布">布</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/布">布</a>
<span id = "number">406</span><title>帆</title>	<p>A sail made of a towel makes a mediocre vessel。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帆 はん">ハン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帆 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帆 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帆 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帆ほ">帆ほ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帆">帆</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帆">帆</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帆">帆</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帆">帆</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帆">帆</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帆">帆</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帆">帆</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帆">帆</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帆">帆</a>
<span id = "number">407</span><title>幅</title>	<p>A towel owned by the wealthiest tycoon in the world is made into a hanging scroll after his death and auctioned off to the highest bidder。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幅 ふく">フク</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幅 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幅 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幅 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幅はば">幅はば</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幅">幅</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幅">幅</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幅">幅</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幅">幅</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幅">幅</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幅">幅</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幅">幅</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幅">幅</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幅">幅</a>
<span id = "number">408</span><title>帽</title>	<p>Because of the risk involved （of getting the sun in one’s eyes）、 one puts together a makeshift cap out of a dirty old towel。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帽 ぼう">ボウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帽 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帽 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帽 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帽">帽</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帽">帽</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帽">帽</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帽">帽</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帽">帽</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帽">帽</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帽">帽</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帽">帽</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帽">帽</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帽">帽</a>
<span id = "number">409</span><title>幕</title>	<p>A dirty towel draped over the entrance to the old graveyard is painted to look like the curtain of death that leads to the other world。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幕 まく">マク</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幕 ばく">バク</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幕 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幕 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幕">幕</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幕">幕</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幕">幕</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幕">幕</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幕">幕</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幕">幕</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幕">幕</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幕">幕</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幕">幕</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幕">幕</a>
<span id = "number">410</span><title>幌</title>	<p>A large towel stretched overhead with only a few of the sun’s rays breaking through represents a canopy over one’s bed。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幌 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幌 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幌 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幌 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幌">幌</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幌">幌</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幌">幌</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幌">幌</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幌">幌</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幌">幌</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幌">幌</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幌">幌</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幌">幌</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幌">幌</a>
<span id = "number">411</span><title>錦</title>	<p>A strip of white towel and some scraps of metal have the makings of a primitive kind of brocade。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/錦 きん">キン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/錦 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/錦 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/錦 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/錦にしき">錦にしき</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/錦">錦</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/錦">錦</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/錦">錦</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/錦">錦</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/錦">錦</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/錦">錦</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/錦">錦</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/錦">錦</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/錦">錦</a>
<span id = "number">412</span><title>市</title>	<p>Dressed in nothing but a bath towel and top hat、 one sets off to the marketplace in search of a bargain or two。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/市 し">シ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/市 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/市 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/市 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/市いち">市いち</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/市">市</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/市">市</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/市">市</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/市">市</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/市">市</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/市">市</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/市">市</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/市">市</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/市">市</a>
<span id = "number">413</span><title>姉</title>	<p>Of all the women of the family、 it is the elder sister who has the duty to go to market to do the shopping。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/姉 し">シ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/姉 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/姉 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/姉 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/姉あね">姉あね</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/姉">姉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/姉">姉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/姉">姉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/姉">姉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/姉">姉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/姉">姉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/姉">姉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/姉">姉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/姉">姉</a>
<span id = "number">414</span><title>肺</title>	<p>One is surprised、 strolling through the market、 to find among the meats hung out for sale a slab marked： lungs。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肺 はい">ハイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肺 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肺 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肺 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肺">肺</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肺">肺</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肺">肺</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肺">肺</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肺">肺</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肺">肺</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肺">肺</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肺">肺</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肺">肺</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肺">肺</a>
<span id = "number">415</span><title>帯</title>	<p>The part of the apron where one finds the buckle （represented pictorially by the first 5 strokes） is on the sash。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帯 たい">タイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帯 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帯 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帯 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帯お－びる">帯お－びる</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帯おび">帯おび</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帯">帯</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帯">帯</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帯">帯</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帯">帯</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帯">帯</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帯">帯</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帯">帯</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帯">帯</a>
<span id = "number">416</span><title>滞</title>	<p>People that have been “sashed” to something （whether their mother’s apron strings or a particular job） for too long become like water that has stopped moving： they start to stagnate。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滞 たい">タイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滞 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滞 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滞 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滞とどこお－る">滞とどこお－る</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滞">滞</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滞">滞</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滞">滞</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滞">滞</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滞">滞</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滞">滞</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滞">滞</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滞">滞</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滞">滞</a>
<span id = "number">417</span><title>刺</title>	<p>Thorns grow on a bush here that has wrapped itself around a tree like a belt、 cutting into the poor tree like little sabers。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/刺 し">シ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/刺 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/刺 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/刺 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/刺さ－す">刺さ－す</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/刺さ－さる">刺さ－さる</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/刺">刺</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/刺">刺</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/刺">刺</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/刺">刺</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/刺">刺</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/刺">刺</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/刺">刺</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/刺">刺</a>
<span id = "number">418</span><title>制</title>	<p>This kanji show a unique system for leading cows to the slaughterer’s saber： one ties a belt about their waist and fixes that belt to an overhead cable、 pulling the cow up into the air where it hangs suspended、 helpless against the fate that awai...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/制 せい">セイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/制 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/制 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/制 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/制">制</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/制">制</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/制">制</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/制">制</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/制">制</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/制">制</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/制">制</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/制">制</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/制">制</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/制">制</a>
<span id = "number">419</span><title>製</title>	<p>A label indicating that a garment was made in u。s。a。 or Taiwan or Japan is itself a symbol for the systematization of the garment industry。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/製 せい">セイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/製 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/製 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/製 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/製">製</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/製">製</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/製">製</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/製">製</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/製">製</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/製">製</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/製">製</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/製">製</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/製">製</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/製">製</a>
<span id = "number">420</span><title>転</title>	<p>As the wheels of the car revolve、 they kick up small rising clouds of dust and debris behind them。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/転 てん">テン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/転 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/転 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/転 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/転ころ－がる">転ころ－がる</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/転ころ－げる">転ころ－げる</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/転ころ－がす">転ころ－がす</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/転ころ－ぶ">転ころ－ぶ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/転">転</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/転">転</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/転">転</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/転">転</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/転">転</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/転">転</a>
<span id = "number">421</span><title>芸</title>	<p>The secret technique of making a rising cloud of smoke turn into a bouquet of flowers is shown here。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/芸 げい">ゲイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/芸 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/芸 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/芸 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/芸">芸</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/芸">芸</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/芸">芸</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/芸">芸</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/芸">芸</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/芸">芸</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/芸">芸</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/芸">芸</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/芸">芸</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/芸">芸</a>
<span id = "number">422</span><title>雨</title>	<p>This kanji、 also a primitive、 is one of the clearest instances we have of a complex pictograph。 The top line is the sky、 the next 3 strokes a pair of clouds、 and the final 4 dots the rain collected there and waiting to fall。  As a primitive i...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雨 う">ウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雨 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雨 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雨 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雨あめ">雨あめ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雨あま">雨あま</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雨">雨</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雨">雨</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雨">雨</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雨">雨</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雨">雨</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雨">雨</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雨">雨</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雨">雨</a>
<span id = "number">423</span><title>雲</title>	<p>Here is the full character for cloud from which the primitive for a rising cloud derives。 Clouds begin with vapors rising up in small clouds from the surface of the earth、 and then gathering to make clouds that eventually dump their rain back on the ...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雲 うん">ウン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雲 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雲 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雲 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雲くも">雲くも</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雲">雲</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雲">雲</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雲">雲</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雲">雲</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雲">雲</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雲">雲</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雲">雲</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雲">雲</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雲">雲</a>
<span id = "number">424</span><title>曇</title>	<p>We refer to days when the sun is covered by the clouds as cloudy weather。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/曇 どん">ドン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/曇 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/曇 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/曇 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/曇くも－る">曇くも－る</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/曇">曇</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/曇">曇</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/曇">曇</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/曇">曇</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/曇">曇</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/曇">曇</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/曇">曇</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/曇">曇</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/曇">曇</a>
<span id = "number">425</span><title>雷</title>	<p>The full rumble and roar and terror of thunder is best felt not with your head tucked under your pillow safe in bed、 but out in an open rice field where you can get the real feel of the weather。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雷 らい">ライ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雷 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雷 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雷 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雷かみなり">雷かみなり</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雷">雷</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雷">雷</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雷">雷</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雷">雷</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雷">雷</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雷">雷</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雷">雷</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雷">雷</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/雷">雷</a>
<span id = "number">426</span><title>霜</title>	<p>Think of frost as a cooperative venture、 an inter－action of the malevolent forces of weather that sit around a conference table and finally decide to allow a very light amount of moisture to fall just before a short and sudden freeze。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/霜 そう">ソウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/霜 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/霜 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/霜 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/霜しも">霜しも</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/霜">霜</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/霜">霜</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/霜">霜</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/霜">霜</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/霜">霜</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/霜">霜</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/霜">霜</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/霜">霜</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/霜">霜</a>
<span id = "number">427</span><title>冬</title>	<p>Walking legs slipping on the ice are a sure sign of winter。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/冬 とう">トウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/冬 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/冬 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/冬 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/冬ふゆ">冬ふゆ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/冬">冬</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/冬">冬</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/冬">冬</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/冬">冬</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/冬">冬</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/冬">冬</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/冬">冬</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/冬">冬</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/冬">冬</a>
