<span id = "number">428</span><title>天</title>	<p>This character is meant to be a pictograph of a great man、 said to represent the Lord of the Heavens。 （You may、 of course、 use the elements ceiling and St。 Bernard instead。）  The primitive can mean either the heaven of eternal bliss or th...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/天 てん">テン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/天 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/天 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/天 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/天あめ">天あめ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/天あま">天あま</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/天">天</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/天">天</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/天">天</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/天">天</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/天">天</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/天">天</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/天">天</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/天">天</a>
<span id = "number">429</span><title>橋</title>	<p>The bridge shown here is made of trees in their natural form、 except that the trunks have been carved into the forms of angels、 a sort of “Ponte degli Angeli。”</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/橋 きょう">キョウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/橋 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/橋 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/橋 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/橋はし">橋はし</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/橋">橋</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/橋">橋</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/橋">橋</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/橋">橋</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/橋">橋</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/橋">橋</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/橋">橋</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/橋">橋</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/橋">橋</a>
<span id = "number">430</span><title>嬌</title>	<p>Associating a particularly attractive woman you know with an angel should be no problem。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/嬌 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/嬌 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/嬌 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/嬌 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/嬌">嬌</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/嬌">嬌</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/嬌">嬌</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/嬌">嬌</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/嬌">嬌</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/嬌">嬌</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/嬌">嬌</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/嬌">嬌</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/嬌">嬌</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/嬌">嬌</a>
<span id = "number">431</span><title>立</title>	<p>This picture of a vase standing up has its meaning extended to represent the general posture of anything standing up。  Used as a primitive、 it can also mean vase。 Using its kanji meaning、 think of something standing up that is normally lying down...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/立 りつ">リツ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/立 りゅう">リュウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/立 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/立 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/立た－つ">立た－つ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/立た－てる">立た－てる</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/立">立</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/立">立</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/立">立</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/立">立</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/立">立</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/立">立</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/立">立</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/立">立</a>
<span id = "number">432</span><title>泣</title>	<p>One cries and cries until one is standing up knee－deep in water （or until one has a vase－full of water）。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/泣 きゅう">キュウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/泣 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/泣 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/泣 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/泣な－く">泣な－く</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/泣">泣</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/泣">泣</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/泣">泣</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/泣">泣</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/泣">泣</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/泣">泣</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/泣">泣</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/泣">泣</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/泣">泣</a>
<span id = "number">433</span><title>章</title>	<p>Try to imagine a club badge pinned to your lapel in the form of a mammoth sunflower protruding from a wee little vase。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/章 しょう">ショウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/章 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/章 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/章 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/章">章</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/章">章</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/章">章</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/章">章</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/章">章</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/章">章</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/章">章</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/章">章</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/章">章</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/章">章</a>
<span id = "number">434</span><title>競</title>	<p>Two teenagers are seen here standing up to one another、 vying for the attention of their peers。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/競 きょう">キョウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/競 けい">ケイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/競 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/競 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/競きそ－う">競きそ－う</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/競せ－る">競せ－る</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/競">競</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/競">競</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/競">競</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/競">競</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/競">競</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/競">競</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/競">競</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/競">競</a>
<span id = "number">435</span><title>帝</title>	<p>An uncommon、 but not altogether unlikely picture of a reigning sovereign has him standing up in his apron、 presumably at the behest of his sovereign （she who is to be obeyed）、 who needs help with washing the dishes。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帝 てい">テイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帝 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帝 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帝 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帝">帝</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帝">帝</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帝">帝</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帝">帝</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帝">帝</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帝">帝</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帝">帝</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帝">帝</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帝">帝</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/帝">帝</a>
<span id = "number">436</span><title>童</title>	<p>This frame shows up the image of a juvenile hacker standing on top of a computer、 or rather jumping up and down on it、 because it refused to come up with the right answer。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/童 どう">ドウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/童 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/童 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/童 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/童わらべ">童わらべ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/童">童</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/童">童</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/童">童</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/童">童</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/童">童</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/童">童</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/童">童</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/童">童</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/童">童</a>
<span id = "number">437</span><title>瞳</title>	<p>Begin with the double meaning of the key word pupil： “student” and the “apple of one’s eye。” Now all you have to do is dwell on the phrase “juvenile of one’s eye” （the meaning here） until it provides you with an image。 </p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/瞳 どう">ドウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/瞳 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/瞳 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/瞳 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/瞳ひとみ">瞳ひとみ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/瞳">瞳</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/瞳">瞳</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/瞳">瞳</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/瞳">瞳</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/瞳">瞳</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/瞳">瞳</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/瞳">瞳</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/瞳">瞳</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/瞳">瞳</a>
<span id = "number">438</span><title>鐘</title>	<p>This bell is made of cheap metal、 and so badly made that when you ring it、 it lets out a noise like the “bellowing” of juveniles who aren’t getting their own way。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鐘 しょう">ショウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鐘 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鐘 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鐘 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鐘かね">鐘かね</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鐘">鐘</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鐘">鐘</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鐘">鐘</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鐘">鐘</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鐘">鐘</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鐘">鐘</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鐘">鐘</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鐘">鐘</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鐘">鐘</a>
<span id = "number">439</span><title>商</title>	<p>See the peddler standing atop his motorcycle helmet as if it were a soapbox、 hawking his wares to passersby。 The legs and mouth represent the tools of the trade of making a deal any way you can。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/商 しょう">ショウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/商 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/商 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/商 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/商あきな－う">商あきな－う</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/商">商</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/商">商</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/商">商</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/商">商</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/商">商</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/商">商</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/商">商</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/商">商</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/商">商</a>
<span id = "number">440</span><title>嫡</title>	<p>The phrase legitimate wife would have no meaning if there were not such things as “illegitimate wives、” taken because one’s legal woman has turned into an antique。 The very off ense of the idea should help you remember the kanji。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/嫡 ちゃく">チャク</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/嫡 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/嫡 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/嫡 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/嫡">嫡</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/嫡">嫡</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/嫡">嫡</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/嫡">嫡</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/嫡">嫡</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/嫡">嫡</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/嫡">嫡</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/嫡">嫡</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/嫡">嫡</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/嫡">嫡</a>
<span id = "number">441</span><title>適</title>	<p>Can you imagine anything less suitable to do with one’s precious antiques than to display them in the middle of a crowded road－way？</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/適 てき">テキ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/適 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/適 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/適 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/適">適</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/適">適</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/適">適</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/適">適</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/適">適</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/適">適</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/適">適</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/適">適</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/適">適</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/適">適</a>
<span id = "number">442</span><title>滴</title>	<p>Picture water dripping on what you thought were precious antiques、 only to find that the artificial aging painted on them is running！</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滴 てき">テキ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滴 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滴 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滴 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滴しずく">滴しずく</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滴したた－る">滴したた－る</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滴">滴</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滴">滴</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滴">滴</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滴">滴</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滴">滴</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滴">滴</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滴">滴</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滴">滴</a>
<span id = "number">443</span><title>敵</title>	<p>Picture your most precious antique （it doesn’t matter how old it really is、 so long as it is the oldest thing you own） being knocked over by your most unlikable taskmaster、 and you have a good picture of how people make themselves enemies for l...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敵 てき">テキ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敵 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敵 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敵 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敵かたき">敵かたき</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敵">敵</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敵">敵</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敵">敵</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敵">敵</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敵">敵</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敵">敵</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敵">敵</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敵">敵</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敵">敵</a>
<span id = "number">444</span><title>匕</title>	<p>This character、 a pictograph of a spoon、 is easy enough to remember、 provided you keep it distinct from that for seven、 where the first stroke is written left to right （the opposite of here） and cuts noticeably across the second。  As a prim...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/匕 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/匕 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/匕 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/匕 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/匕">匕</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/匕">匕</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/匕">匕</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/匕">匕</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/匕">匕</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/匕">匕</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/匕">匕</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/匕">匕</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/匕">匕</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/匕">匕</a>
<span id = "number">445</span><title>北</title>	<p>The cold air from the north is so strong that we see two people sitting on the ground back to back、 their arms interlocked so they don’t blow away。 （Pay special attention to the drawing of the first 3 strokes。） </p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/北 ほく">ホク</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/北 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/北 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/北 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/北きた">北きた</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/北">北</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/北">北</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/北">北</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/北">北</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/北">北</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/北">北</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/北">北</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/北">北</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/北">北</a>
<span id = "number">446</span><title>背</title>	<p>One’s stature is measured according to the “northern－most” part of the body。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/背 はい">ハイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/背 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/背 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/背 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/背せ">背せ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/背せい">背せい</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/背そむ－く">背そむ－く</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/背そむ－ける">背そむ－ける</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/背">背</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/背">背</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/背">背</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/背">背</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/背">背</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/背">背</a>
<span id = "number">447</span><title>比</title>	<p>With two spoons、 one in each hand、 you are comparing your mother’s cooking with your mother－in－law’s。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/比 ひ">ヒ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/比 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/比 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/比 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/比くら－べる">比くら－べる</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/比">比</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/比">比</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/比">比</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/比">比</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/比">比</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/比">比</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/比">比</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/比">比</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/比">比</a>
<span id = "number">448</span><title>昆</title>	<p>By comparing apes with anthropoids、 we not only discover the latter have descended from those progenitors educated in the higher branches、 but that the very idea of seeing everything descended from everything else、 one way or another、 means that ...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/昆 こん">コン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/昆 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/昆 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/昆 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/昆">昆</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/昆">昆</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/昆">昆</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/昆">昆</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/昆">昆</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/昆">昆</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/昆">昆</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/昆">昆</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/昆">昆</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/昆">昆</a>
<span id = "number">449</span><title>皆</title>	<p>Think of the housewives in tv commercials “comparing the whiteness” of their laundry across the fence、 a typical advertisement for the popular detergent known as All。 （If you don’t know the brand、 surely you’ve heard the phrases “all－...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/皆 かい">カイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/皆 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/皆 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/皆 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/皆みな">皆みな</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/皆">皆</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/皆">皆</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/皆">皆</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/皆">皆</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/皆">皆</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/皆">皆</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/皆">皆</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/皆">皆</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/皆">皆</a>
<span id = "number">450</span><title>混</title>	<p>Mixed marriages、 this character suggests、 water down the quality of one’s descendants—the oldest racial nonsense in the world！</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/混 こん">コン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/混 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/混 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/混 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/混ま－じる">混ま－じる</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/混ま－ざる">混ま－ざる</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/混ま－ぜる">混ま－ぜる</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/混こ－む">混こ－む</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/混">混</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/混">混</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/混">混</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/混">混</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/混">混</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/混">混</a>
<span id = "number">451</span><title>渇</title>	<p>As you pass by the muchacho taking the siesta、 he cries out that he is thirsty and asks for something to drink。 So you turn the water hose on him。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/渇 かつ">カツ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/渇 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/渇 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/渇 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/渇かわ－く">渇かわ－く</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/渇">渇</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/渇">渇</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/渇">渇</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/渇">渇</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/渇">渇</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/渇">渇</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/渇">渇</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/渇">渇</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/渇">渇</a>
<span id = "number">452</span><title>謁</title>	<p>Imagine an audience with the emperor or the pope in which all those in attendance are sitting down、 leaning against the wall、 sleeping like our muchacho on siesta、 as the honorable host delivers his speech。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/謁 えつ">エツ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/謁 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/謁 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/謁 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/謁">謁</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/謁">謁</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/謁">謁</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/謁">謁</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/謁">謁</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/謁">謁</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/謁">謁</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/謁">謁</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/謁">謁</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/謁">謁</a>
<span id = "number">453</span><title>褐</title>	<p>The color of the serape or cloak of our muchacho on siesta is a dull brown、 the color this kanji indicates。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/褐 かつ">カツ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/褐 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/褐 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/褐 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/褐">褐</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/褐">褐</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/褐">褐</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/褐">褐</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/褐">褐</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/褐">褐</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/褐">褐</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/褐">褐</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/褐">褐</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/褐">褐</a>
<span id = "number">454</span><title>喝</title>	<p>When the muchacho on siesta looks up and opens his mouth to talk、 his voice is so hoarse you cannot understand him。 </p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/喝 かつ">カツ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/喝 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/喝 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/喝 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/喝">喝</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/喝">喝</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/喝">喝</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/喝">喝</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/喝">喝</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/喝">喝</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/喝">喝</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/喝">喝</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/喝">喝</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/喝">喝</a>
<span id = "number">455</span><title>旨</title>	<p>Something is so downright delicious that one spends the entire day with a spoon in hand gobbling it up。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/旨 し">シ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/旨 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/旨 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/旨 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/旨むね">旨むね</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/旨">旨</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/旨">旨</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/旨">旨</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/旨">旨</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/旨">旨</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/旨">旨</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/旨">旨</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/旨">旨</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/旨">旨</a>
<span id = "number">456</span><title>脂</title>	<p>This kanji tells us that if you feed the flesh with too many delicious things、 it soon picks up a thick layer of fat。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/脂 し">シ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/脂 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/脂 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/脂 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/脂あぶら">脂あぶら</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/脂">脂</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/脂">脂</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/脂">脂</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/脂">脂</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/脂">脂</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/脂">脂</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/脂">脂</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/脂">脂</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/脂">脂</a>
<span id = "number">457</span><title>壱</title>	<p>The Roman numeral i—like that for ii we met earlier in frame 355 弐—is only rarely used now。 In the midst of all the samurai、 we notice one in particular sitting on the ground with a crown on his head、 indicating that he is “number i” in t...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/壱 いち">イチ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/壱 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/壱 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/壱 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/壱">壱</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/壱">壱</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/壱">壱</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/壱">壱</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/壱">壱</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/壱">壱</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/壱">壱</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/壱">壱</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/壱">壱</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/壱">壱</a>
<span id = "number">458</span><title>毎</title>	<p>“Behind every successful person lies a woman…、” who usually turns out to be one’s mama！</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/毎 まい">マイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/毎 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/毎 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/毎 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/毎">毎</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/毎">毎</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/毎">毎</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/毎">毎</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/毎">毎</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/毎">毎</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/毎">毎</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/毎">毎</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/毎">毎</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/毎">毎</a>
<span id = "number">459</span><title>敏</title>	<p>Behind every successful taskmaster、 the cleverness of a fox to outwit his charges。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敏 びん">ビン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敏 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敏 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敏 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敏">敏</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敏">敏</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敏">敏</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敏">敏</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敏">敏</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敏">敏</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敏">敏</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敏">敏</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敏">敏</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敏">敏</a>
<span id = "number">460</span><title>梅</title>	<p>Behind every Jack Horner’s pie maker、 a tree full of plums。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/梅 ばい">バイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/梅 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/梅 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/梅 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/梅うめ">梅うめ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/梅">梅</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/梅">梅</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/梅">梅</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/梅">梅</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/梅">梅</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/梅">梅</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/梅">梅</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/梅">梅</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/梅">梅</a>
<span id = "number">461</span><title>海</title>	<p>Behind every drop of water、 a sea from which it originated。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/海 かい">カイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/海 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/海 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/海 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/海うみ">海うみ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/海">海</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/海">海</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/海">海</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/海">海</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/海">海</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/海">海</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/海">海</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/海">海</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/海">海</a>
<span id = "number">462</span><title>乞</title>	<p>See someone lying down in a public place with a hook in place of a hand、 begging a morsel of rice or a few pence。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/乞 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/乞 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/乞 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/乞 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/乞こ－う">乞こ－う</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/乞">乞</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/乞">乞</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/乞">乞</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/乞">乞</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/乞">乞</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/乞">乞</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/乞">乞</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/乞">乞</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/乞">乞</a>
<span id = "number">463</span><title>乾</title>	<p>In times of drought anything at all will do。 Here we see the victims begging for just a little mist for relief。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/乾 かん">カン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/乾 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/乾 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/乾 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/乾かわ－く">乾かわ－く</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/乾かわ－かす">乾かわ－かす</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/乾">乾</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/乾">乾</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/乾">乾</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/乾">乾</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/乾">乾</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/乾">乾</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/乾">乾</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/乾">乾</a>
<span id = "number">464</span><title>腹</title>	<p>If you double back （fold over） most animals—or people、 for that matter—in the middle、 the part of the body where the crease comes is the abdomen。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/腹 ふく">フク</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/腹 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/腹 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/腹 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/腹はら">腹はら</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/腹">腹</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/腹">腹</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/腹">腹</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/腹">腹</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/腹">腹</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/腹">腹</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/腹">腹</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/腹">腹</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/腹">腹</a>
<span id = "number">465</span><title>複</title>	<p>In its original and etymologically transparent sense、 to duplicate something means to double it back with a fold、 like the fold of a cloak。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/複 ふく">フク</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/複 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/複 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/複 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/複">複</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/複">複</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/複">複</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/複">複</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/複">複</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/複">複</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/複">複</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/複">複</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/複">複</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/複">複</a>
<span id = "number">466</span><title>欠</title>	<p>The pictograph hidden in this character is of someone yawning。 The first stroke shows the head thrown back； the second、 the arm bent at the elbow as the hand reaches up to cover the mouth； and the last two、 the legs。 Since yawning shows a lac...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/欠 けつ">ケツ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/欠 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/欠 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/欠 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/欠か－ける">欠か－ける</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/欠か－く">欠か－く</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/欠">欠</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/欠">欠</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/欠">欠</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/欠">欠</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/欠">欠</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/欠">欠</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/欠">欠</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/欠">欠</a>
<span id = "number">467</span><title>吹</title>	<p>To blow is really no more than a deliberate eff ort to make one’s mouth lack all the air that is in it。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/吹 すい">スイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/吹 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/吹 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/吹 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/吹ふ－く">吹ふ－く</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/吹">吹</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/吹">吹</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/吹">吹</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/吹">吹</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/吹">吹</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/吹">吹</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/吹">吹</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/吹">吹</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/吹">吹</a>
<span id = "number">468</span><title>炊</title>	<p>Better to picture what happens when you do not pay attention to your work in the kitchen。 Here we see a blazing fire and an inattentive、 yawning cook who let things get out of control。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/炊 すい">スイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/炊 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/炊 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/炊 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/炊た－く">炊た－く</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/炊">炊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/炊">炊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/炊">炊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/炊">炊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/炊">炊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/炊">炊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/炊">炊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/炊">炊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/炊">炊</a>
<span id = "number">469</span><title>歌</title>	<p>The song in this kanji is being sung by a chorus line of can－can girls。 Why it should be eliciting nothing but yawning from the audience、 I leave to you to decide。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歌 か">カ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歌 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歌 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歌 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歌うた">歌うた</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歌うた－う">歌うた－う</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歌">歌</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歌">歌</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歌">歌</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歌">歌</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歌">歌</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歌">歌</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歌">歌</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/歌">歌</a>
<span id = "number">470</span><title>軟</title>	<p>If the cushions of one’s car are too soft、 one may begin yawning at the wheel。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/軟 なん">ナン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/軟 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/軟 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/軟 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/軟やわ－らか">軟やわ－らか</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/軟やわ－らかい">軟やわ－らかい</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/軟">軟</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/軟">軟</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/軟">軟</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/軟">軟</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/軟">軟</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/軟">軟</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/軟">軟</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/軟">軟</a>
<span id = "number">471</span><title>次</title>	<p>This key word connotes the “next in line” of a succession of people or things。 Let there be a lack of ice on the hottest day of summer、 and you stand impatiently in line waiting for the distributor to call out “Next！”  As a primitive、 thi...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/次 じ">ジ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/次 し">シ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/次 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/次 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/次つ－ぐ">次つ－ぐ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/次つぎ">次つぎ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/次">次</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/次">次</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/次">次</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/次">次</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/次">次</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/次">次</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/次">次</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/次">次</a>
<span id = "number">472</span><title>茨</title>	<p>Earlier we made mention of the story of Briar Rose （or “Sleeping Beauty、” as we called her in frame 154 垣） and drew attention to the briar hedge that grew up all about her castle。 But in the second part of the story、 these briars blossome...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/茨 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/茨 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/茨 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/茨 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/茨いばら">茨いばら</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/茨">茨</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/茨">茨</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/茨">茨</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/茨">茨</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/茨">茨</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/茨">茨</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/茨">茨</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/茨">茨</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/茨">茨</a>
<span id = "number">473</span><title>資</title>	<p>The first shells （money） you earn、 you use to pay your debts。 From then on、 the next shells you accumulate become your assets。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/資 し">シ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/資 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/資 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/資 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/資">資</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/資">資</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/資">資</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/資">資</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/資">資</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/資">資</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/資">資</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/資">資</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/資">資</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/資">資</a>
<span id = "number">474</span><title>姿</title>	<p>This kanji depicts a woman’s figure as a sort of second self。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/姿 し">シ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/姿 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/姿 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/姿 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/姿すがた">姿すがた</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/姿">姿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/姿">姿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/姿">姿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/姿">姿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/姿">姿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/姿">姿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/姿">姿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/姿">姿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/姿">姿</a>
<span id = "number">475</span><title>諮</title>	<p>To seek the words of a second mouth is to consult with someone about something。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/諮 し">シ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/諮 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/諮 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/諮 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/諮はか－る">諮はか－る</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/諮">諮</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/諮">諮</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/諮">諮</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/諮">諮</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/諮">諮</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/諮">諮</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/諮">諮</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/諮">諮</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/諮">諮</a>
<span id = "number">476</span><title>賠</title>	<p>Picture a clam used as a muzzle to quiet the complaints of a fisherman’s widow asking compensation for her husband lost at sea。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/賠 ばい">バイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/賠 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/賠 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/賠 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/賠">賠</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/賠">賠</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/賠">賠</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/賠">賠</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/賠">賠</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/賠">賠</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/賠">賠</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/賠">賠</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/賠">賠</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/賠">賠</a>
<span id = "number">477</span><title>培</title>	<p>The barrel hoops used by many Japanese farmers to stretch clear plastic over row of vegetables in a garden patch in the hopes of cultivating bigger and bigger vegetables is a way of muzzling the soil。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/培 ばい">バイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/培 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/培 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/培 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/培つちか－う">培つちか－う</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/培">培</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/培">培</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/培">培</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/培">培</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/培">培</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/培">培</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/培">培</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/培">培</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/培">培</a>
<span id = "number">478</span><title>剖</title>	<p>To “divide and conquer” you use a saber and a muzzle。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/剖 ぼう">ボウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/剖 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/剖 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/剖 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/剖">剖</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/剖">剖</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/剖">剖</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/剖">剖</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/剖">剖</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/剖">剖</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/剖">剖</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/剖">剖</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/剖">剖</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/剖">剖</a>
<span id = "number">479</span><title>音</title>	<p>The kanji for sound depicts something standing in the air over a tongue wagging in a mouth、 much the same as a sound does for the briefest of moments before disappearing。  The primitive from this kanji also means simply a sound。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/音 おん">オン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/音 いん">イン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/音 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/音 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/音おと">音おと</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/音ね">音ね</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/音">音</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/音">音</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/音">音</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/音">音</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/音">音</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/音">音</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/音">音</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/音">音</a>
<span id = "number">480</span><title>暗</title>	<p>When “darkness covered the earth” at the beginning of time、 there was neither sun nor sound。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/暗 あん">アン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/暗 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/暗 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/暗 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/暗くら－い">暗くら－い</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/暗">暗</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/暗">暗</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/暗">暗</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/暗">暗</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/暗">暗</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/暗">暗</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/暗">暗</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/暗">暗</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/暗">暗</a>
<span id = "number">481</span><title>韻</title>	<p>Poetry restricted to verses that rhyme often finds it has to abandon clarity of thought in order to make the rhyme of the words work。 In this kanji’s picture、 one becomes a kind of “soundemployee。”  ┷ kazoo This primitive’s special useful...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/韻 いん">イン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/韻 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/韻 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/韻 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/韻">韻</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/韻">韻</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/韻">韻</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/韻">韻</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/韻">韻</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/韻">韻</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/韻">韻</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/韻">韻</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/韻">韻</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/韻">韻</a>
<span id = "number">482</span><title>識</title>	<p>A person of discriminating intellect can tell the diff erence between mere kazoo－buzzing and words spoken wisely。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/識 しき">シキ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/識 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/識 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/識 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/識">識</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/識">識</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/識">識</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/識">識</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/識">識</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/識">識</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/識">識</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/識">識</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/識">識</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/識">識</a>
<span id = "number">483</span><title>鏡</title>	<p>After lakes but before glass、 polished metal was used for mirrors。 These metal mirrors are recalled in this character for a mirror。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鏡 きょう">キョウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鏡 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鏡 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鏡 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鏡かがみ">鏡かがみ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鏡">鏡</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鏡">鏡</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鏡">鏡</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鏡">鏡</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鏡">鏡</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鏡">鏡</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鏡">鏡</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鏡">鏡</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鏡">鏡</a>
<span id = "number">484</span><title>境</title>	<p>Imagine the boundary of a plot of land marked with gigantic mirrors enabling the landowner to keep trespassers in sight at all times。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/境 きょう">キョウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/境 けい">ケイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/境 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/境 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/境さかい">境さかい</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/境">境</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/境">境</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/境">境</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/境">境</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/境">境</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/境">境</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/境">境</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/境">境</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/境">境</a>
<span id = "number">485</span><title>亡</title>	<p>A top hat hanging on a hook in the front hall、 right where the deceased left it the day he died、 reminds us of him and his kanji。 In addition to deceased、 the primitive meaning of to perish will also be used for this character。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/亡 ぼう">ボウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/亡 もう">モウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/亡 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/亡 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/亡な－い">亡な－い</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/亡">亡</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/亡">亡</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/亡">亡</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/亡">亡</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/亡">亡</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/亡">亡</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/亡">亡</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/亡">亡</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/亡">亡</a>
<span id = "number">486</span><title>盲</title>	<p>If one’s eyes perish before death、 one remains blind for the rest of life。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/盲 もう">モウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/盲 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/盲 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/盲 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/盲">盲</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/盲">盲</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/盲">盲</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/盲">盲</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/盲">盲</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/盲">盲</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/盲">盲</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/盲">盲</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/盲">盲</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/盲">盲</a>
<span id = "number">487</span><title>妄</title>	<p>The “ideal woman” one daydreams about is no more than a delusion。 Hence、 perish the thought of her。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妄 もう">モウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妄 ぼう">ボウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妄 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妄 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妄">妄</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妄">妄</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妄">妄</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妄">妄</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妄">妄</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妄">妄</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妄">妄</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妄">妄</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妄">妄</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妄">妄</a>
<span id = "number">488</span><title>荒</title>	<p>The flowers that perish in the flood are taken here as symbols of an area that has been laid waste。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/荒 こう">コウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/荒 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/荒 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/荒 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/荒あら－い">荒あら－い</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/荒あ－れる">荒あ－れる</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/荒あ－らす">荒あ－らす</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/荒">荒</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/荒">荒</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/荒">荒</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/荒">荒</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/荒">荒</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/荒">荒</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/荒">荒</a>
<span id = "number">489</span><title>望</title>	<p>The story of ambition talks of a king walking under the perishing （or “waning”） moon dreaming great dreams about his kingdom。 （The roots of ambition are from the same word as “ambulate、” meaning to walk about。）</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/望 ぼう">ボウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/望 もう">モウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/望 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/望 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/望のぞ－む">望のぞ－む</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/望">望</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/望">望</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/望">望</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/望">望</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/望">望</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/望">望</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/望">望</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/望">望</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/望">望</a>
<span id = "number">490</span><title>方</title>	<p>Spinning a dagger about on its hilt on the top of a top hat— waiting to see in which direction it points when it comes to rest—one leaves to fate where one is going next。 Take care in writing this character。  As a primitive、 this character will...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/方 ほう">ホウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/方 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/方 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/方 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/方かた">方かた</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/方">方</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/方">方</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/方">方</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/方">方</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/方">方</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/方">方</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/方">方</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/方">方</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/方">方</a>
<span id = "number">491</span><title>妨</title>	<p>Imagine a compass that is disturbed every time a woman passes by、 sending the needle spinning madly round and round。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妨 ぼう">ボウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妨 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妨 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妨 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妨さまた－げる">妨さまた－げる</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妨">妨</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妨">妨</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妨">妨</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妨">妨</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妨">妨</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妨">妨</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妨">妨</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妨">妨</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妨">妨</a>
<span id = "number">492</span><title>坊</title>	<p>The character for a boy shows us a Boy Scout cleaning the dirt out of his compass—the more dirt、 the better。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/坊 ぼう">ボウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/坊 ぼっ">ボッ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/坊 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/坊 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/坊">坊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/坊">坊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/坊">坊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/坊">坊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/坊">坊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/坊">坊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/坊">坊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/坊">坊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/坊">坊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/坊">坊</a>
<span id = "number">493</span><title>芳</title>	<p>Here we see a special compass used to pick out those flowers most suited for making good perfumes。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/芳 ほう">ホウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/芳 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/芳 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/芳 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/芳かんば－しい">芳かんば－しい</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/芳">芳</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/芳">芳</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/芳">芳</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/芳">芳</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/芳">芳</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/芳">芳</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/芳">芳</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/芳">芳</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/芳">芳</a>
<span id = "number">494</span><title>肪</title>	<p>If you eat too much、 you may need a compass to find your way around the obese mass of flesh that piles up in your midsection。 Compare this with the stories for round （frame 44 丸） and fat （frame 456 脂）、 similar in meaning but distinct in...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肪 ぼう">ボウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肪 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肪 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肪 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肪">肪</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肪">肪</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肪">肪</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肪">肪</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肪">肪</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肪">肪</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肪">肪</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肪">肪</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肪">肪</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肪">肪</a>
<span id = "number">495</span><title>訪</title>	<p>When making a courtesy call on a dignitary、 one has to gauge one’s words with great care。 Hence the need for a compass。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/訪 ほう">ホウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/訪 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/訪 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/訪 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/訪おとず－れる">訪おとず－れる</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/訪たず－ねる">訪たず－ねる</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/訪">訪</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/訪">訪</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/訪">訪</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/訪">訪</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/訪">訪</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/訪">訪</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/訪">訪</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/訪">訪</a>
<span id = "number">496</span><title>放</title>	<p>The taskmaster sets an unruly servant free、 giving him no more than a quick glance at the compass and a boot from behind。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/放 ほう">ホウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/放 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/放 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/放 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/放はな－す">放はな－す</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/放はな－つ">放はな－つ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/放はな－れる">放はな－れる</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/放ほう－る">放ほう－る</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/放">放</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/放">放</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/放">放</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/放">放</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/放">放</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/放">放</a>
<span id = "number">497</span><title>激</title>	<p>Some cosmic taskmaster hovering overhead whips up the waves to make them dash violently against the shore。 In the white foam that covers the water we see a broken compass floating、 all that remains of a shipwreck。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/激 げき">ゲキ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/激 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/激 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/激 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/激はげ－しい">激はげ－しい</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/激">激</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/激">激</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/激">激</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/激">激</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/激">激</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/激">激</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/激">激</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/激">激</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/激">激</a>
<span id = "number">498</span><title>脱</title>	<p>To undress is to expose the flesh and tempt the devil in the eyes of one’s onlookers。 Ignore the moral if you want、 but not the devil。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/脱 だつ">ダツ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/脱 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/脱 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/脱 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/脱ぬ－ぐ">脱ぬ－ぐ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/脱ぬ－げる">脱ぬ－げる</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/脱">脱</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/脱">脱</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/脱">脱</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/脱">脱</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/脱">脱</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/脱">脱</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/脱">脱</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/脱">脱</a>
<span id = "number">499</span><title>説</title>	<p>Not inappropriately、 this character likens an explanation to the devil’s own words。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/説 せつ">セツ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/説 ぜい">ゼイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/説 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/説 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/説と－く">説と－く</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/説">説</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/説">説</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/説">説</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/説">説</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/説">説</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/説">説</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/説">説</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/説">説</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/説">説</a>
<span id = "number">500</span><title>鋭</title>	<p>Metal that has been pointed （as an awl、 a pick、 a nail、 or a knife） tends to serve the devil’s purposes as well as civilization’s： our tools are also our weapons。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鋭 えい">エイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鋭 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鋭 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鋭 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鋭するど－い">鋭するど－い</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鋭">鋭</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鋭">鋭</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鋭">鋭</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鋭">鋭</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鋭">鋭</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鋭">鋭</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鋭">鋭</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鋭">鋭</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鋭">鋭</a>
<span id = "number">501</span><title>曽</title>	<p>This primitive （named for its associations with the kanji of the following frame） is composed of a pair of horns growing out of a brain with a tongue wagging in the mouth beneath。 Think of “former” in connection with administrators or heads of ...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/曽 そう">ソウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/曽 ぞ">ゾ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/曽 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/曽 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/曽">曽</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/曽">曽</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/曽">曽</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/曽">曽</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/曽">曽</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/曽">曽</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/曽">曽</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/曽">曽</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/曽">曽</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/曽">曽</a>
<span id = "number">502</span><title>増</title>	<p>This kanji depicts an increase of soil、 multiplying so fast that it literally buries everything in its path。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/増 ぞう">ゾウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/増 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/増 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/増 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/増ま－す">増ま－す</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/増ふ－える">増ふ－える</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/増ふ－やす">増ふ－やす</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/増">増</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/増">増</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/増">増</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/増">増</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/増">増</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/増">増</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/増">増</a>
<span id = "number">503</span><title>贈</title>	<p>The presents off ered here are money that increases each time you give it away。 Do not confuse with the temporal word “present” （frame 259 現）。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/贈 ぞう">ゾウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/贈 そう">ソウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/贈 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/贈 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/贈おく－る">贈おく－る</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/贈">贈</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/贈">贈</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/贈">贈</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/贈">贈</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/贈">贈</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/贈">贈</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/贈">贈</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/贈">贈</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/贈">贈</a>

<span id = "number">516</span><title>池</title>	<p>Water 。 。 。 scorpion。 It would be easy to slip into a “lazy image” in cases like this one、 picturing、 let us say、 a scorpion near the water。 But if you picture rather a scorpion letting its venom out drop by drop until it has made a w...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/池 ち">チ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/池 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/池 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/池 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/池いけ">池いけ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/池">池</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/池">池</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/池">池</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/池">池</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/池">池</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/池">池</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/池">池</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/池">池</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/池">池</a>

<span id = "number">534</span><title>亀</title>	<p>This is not a turtle （see frame 235 兆） but a tortoise、 however you wish to picture the diff erence。 Let the “bound up” at the top refer to the head、 and the two suns、 with a long tail running through it、 to the shell。  As a primitiv...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/亀 き">キ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/亀 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/亀 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/亀 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/亀かめ">亀かめ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/亀">亀</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/亀">亀</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/亀">亀</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/亀">亀</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/亀">亀</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/亀">亀</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/亀">亀</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/亀">亀</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/亀">亀</a>

<span id = "number">536</span><title>竜</title>	<p>Vase 。 。 。 eel。 In order not to confuse this kanji with the zodiacal sign of the dragon、 which we will meet later （frame 2008 辰） and use as a primitive、 you might think here of a paper parade dragon。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/竜 りゅう">リュウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/竜 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/竜 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/竜 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/竜たつ">竜たつ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/竜">竜</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/竜">竜</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/竜">竜</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/竜">竜</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/竜">竜</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/竜">竜</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/竜">竜</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/竜">竜</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/竜">竜</a>

<span id = "number">540</span><title>遂</title>	<p>The horns atop the sow suggest a boar at work in the background。 Add the element for a road。 Now create a story whose meaning is： consummate。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遂 すい">スイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遂 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遂 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遂 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遂と－げる">遂と－げる</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遂">遂</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遂">遂</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遂">遂</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遂">遂</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遂">遂</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遂">遂</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遂">遂</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遂">遂</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遂">遂</a>
<span id = "number">541</span><title>家</title>	<p>This is the full character whose primitive form we learned already。 To help a little、 this kanji recalls the times when the “domestic” animals were、 as the word itself suggests、 really kept in the house。 Hence： house 。 。 。 sow。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/家 か">カ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/家 け">ケ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/家 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/家 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/家いえ">家いえ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/家や">家や</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/家">家</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/家">家</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/家">家</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/家">家</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/家">家</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/家">家</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/家">家</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/家">家</a>
<span id = "number">542</span><title>嫁</title>	<p>The kanji in this frame demonstrates the traditional Japanese approach to marriage： it is the woman who leaves her family for another household、 thus marrying into a man’s family。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/嫁 か">カ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/嫁 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/嫁 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/嫁 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/嫁よめ">嫁よめ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/嫁とつ－ぐ">嫁とつ－ぐ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/嫁">嫁</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/嫁">嫁</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/嫁">嫁</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/嫁">嫁</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/嫁">嫁</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/嫁">嫁</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/嫁">嫁</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/嫁">嫁</a>

<span id = "number">552</span><title>達</title>	<p>The key word is meant to connote someone “skilled” at something。 On the road we find soil over a sheep。 You may have to work with this one a while longer。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/達 たつ">タツ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/達 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/達 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/達 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/達">達</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/達">達</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/達">達</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/達">達</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/達">達</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/達">達</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/達">達</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/達">達</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/達">達</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/達">達</a>
