<span id = "number">566</span><title>奪</title>	<p>Whereas burglary （frame 357 賊） implies clandestine appropriation of another’s property、 robbery refers to taking by force。 The primitive elements： St。 Bernard dog 。 。 。 turkey 。 。 。 glue。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/奪 だつ">ダツ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/奪 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/奪 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/奪 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/奪うば－う">奪うば－う</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/奪">奪</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/奪">奪</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/奪">奪</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/奪">奪</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/奪">奪</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/奪">奪</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/奪">奪</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/奪">奪</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/奪">奪</a>
<span id = "number">567</span><title>確</title>	<p>On the left you see the rock、 which is familiar enough。 But pay attention to the right。 Taking careful note of the unusual stroke order that has the “chimney” on the house doubled up with the first stroke of the turkey、 we may see the right s...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/確 かく">カク</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/確 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/確 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/確 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/確たし－か">確たし－か</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/確たし－かめる">確たし－かめる</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/確">確</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/確">確</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/確">確</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/確">確</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/確">確</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/確">確</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/確">確</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/確">確</a>
<span id = "number">568</span><title>午</title>	<p>With a bit of stretching、 you might see a horse’s head pointing left ward in this character。 That gives the primary meaning of the Chinese zodiacal sign of the horse、 which corresponds to the hour of noon。 Note how this kanji primitive diff ers...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/午 ご">ゴ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/午 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/午 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/午 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/午">午</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/午">午</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/午">午</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/午">午</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/午">午</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/午">午</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/午">午</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/午">午</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/午">午</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/午">午</a>

<span id = "number">635</span><title>必</title>	<p>First note the stroke order of this character、 which did not really evolve from the heart、 even though we take it that way。 If one takes it as a pictograph “dividing” the heart in half、 then one has one of those invariably true bits of human ...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/必 ひつ">ヒツ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/必 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/必 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/必 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/必かなら－ず">必かなら－ず</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/必">必</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/必">必</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/必">必</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/必">必</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/必">必</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/必">必</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/必">必</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/必">必</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/必">必</a>
<span id = "number">636</span><title>泌</title>	<p>Water 。 。 。 the invariably divided heart。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/泌 ひつ">ヒツ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/泌 ひ">ヒ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/泌 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/泌 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/泌">泌</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/泌">泌</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/泌">泌</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/泌">泌</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/泌">泌</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/泌">泌</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/泌">泌</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/泌">泌</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/泌">泌</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/泌">泌</a>
<span id = "number">637</span><title>手</title>	<p>Any way you count them、 there are either too many or too few fingers to see a good pictograph of a hand in this character。 But that it is、 and so you must。  Keep to the etymology when using this kanji as a primitive： a single hand all by itself...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/手 しゅ">シュ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/手 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/手 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/手 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/手て">手て</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/手た">手た</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/手">手</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/手">手</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/手">手</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/手">手</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/手">手</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/手">手</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/手">手</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/手">手</a>

<span id = "number">640</span><title>我</title>	<p>Hand 。 。 。 fiesta。 Note how the second stroke of the hand is stretched across to double up as the first stroke of the tasseled arrow we use for fiesta。 Compare to frames 17、 36、 and 525。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/我 が">ガ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/我 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/我 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/我 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/我われ">我われ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/我わ">我わ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/我">我</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/我">我</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/我">我</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/我">我</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/我">我</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/我">我</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/我">我</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/我">我</a>

<span id = "number">688</span><title>及</title>	<p>The addition of a final stroke transforms this character from the primitive for a clenched fist into the kanji for reaching out、 much as a stroke of kindness can often turn anger into acceptance。  As a primitive、 this shall stand for outstretched h...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/及 きゅう">キュウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/及 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/及 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/及 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/及およ－ぶ">及およ－ぶ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/及およ－び">及およ－び</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/及およ－ぼす">及およ－ぼす</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/及">及</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/及">及</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/及">及</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/及">及</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/及">及</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/及">及</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/及">及</a>
<span id = "number">689</span><title>吸</title>	<p>Mouth 。 。 。 outstretched hands。 Hint： use the image of a nursing baby。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/吸 きゅう">キュウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/吸 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/吸 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/吸 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/吸す－う">吸す－う</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/吸">吸</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/吸">吸</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/吸">吸</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/吸">吸</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/吸">吸</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/吸">吸</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/吸">吸</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/吸">吸</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/吸">吸</a>

<span id = "number">691</span><title>丈</title>	<p>The length whose measure this kanji depicts extends from the tip of one hand to the tip of the other with arms at full length。 Notice the final stroke、 which cuts across the vertical second stroke to distinguish it from large （frame 107）。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/丈 じょう">ジョウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/丈 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/丈 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/丈 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/丈たけ">丈たけ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/丈">丈</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/丈">丈</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/丈">丈</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/丈">丈</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/丈">丈</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/丈">丈</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/丈">丈</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/丈">丈</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/丈">丈</a>

<span id = "number">696</span><title>又</title>	<p>Like the several abbreviations in Roman script to indicate “and” （＋、 ＆、 etc。）、 this short two－stroke kanji is used for the similar meaning of or again。  As a primitive、 it will mean crotch、 as in the crotch of the arm。 Or wh...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/又 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/又 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/又 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/又 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/又また">又また</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/又">又</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/又">又</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/又">又</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/又">又</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/又">又</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/又">又</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/又">又</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/又">又</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/又">又</a>

<span id = "number">757</span><title>互</title>	<p>When you draw this character think of linking two walls together、 one right side up and the other upside down。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/互 ご">ゴ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/互 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/互 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/互 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/互たが－い">互たが－い</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/互">互</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/互">互</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/互">互</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/互">互</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/互">互</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/互">互</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/互">互</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/互">互</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/互">互</a>

<span id = "number">759</span><title>育</title>	<p>Since the key word has to do with raising children to be strong both in mind and body、 it is easy to coordinate the primitive elements： infant 。 。 。 meat。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/育 いく">イク</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/育 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/育 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/育 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/育そだ－つ">育そだ－つ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/育そだ－てる">育そだ－てる</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/育はぐく－む">育はぐく－む</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/育">育</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/育">育</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/育">育</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/育">育</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/育">育</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/育">育</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/育">育</a>

<span id = "number">793</span><title>裕</title>	<p>This character shows the typical cloak of valley folk、 which、 unlike the tailor－made、 high－fashion overcoats of city folk、 is loose－fitting and free－form。 Hence the key word’s meaning of abundant。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/裕 ゆう">ユウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/裕 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/裕 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/裕 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/裕">裕</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/裕">裕</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/裕">裕</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/裕">裕</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/裕">裕</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/裕">裕</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/裕">裕</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/裕">裕</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/裕">裕</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/裕">裕</a>

<span id = "number">795</span><title>沿</title>	<p>Water 。 。 。 gully。 The key word is meant to refer to things like rivers and railway tracks that run alongside something else。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/沿 えん">エン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/沿 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/沿 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/沿 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/沿そ－う">沿そ－う</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/沿">沿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/沿">沿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/沿">沿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/沿">沿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/沿">沿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/沿">沿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/沿">沿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/沿">沿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/沿">沿</a>

<span id = "number">802</span><title>皮</title>	<p>The simplest way to remember this character is to see it as built up from that for branch。 The first stroke can then stand for something “hanging” down from the branch、 namely its bark or pelt。 The barb at the end of the second stroke is the on...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/皮 ひ">ヒ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/皮 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/皮 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/皮 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/皮かわ">皮かわ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/皮">皮</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/皮">皮</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/皮">皮</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/皮">皮</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/皮">皮</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/皮">皮</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/皮">皮</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/皮">皮</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/皮">皮</a>

<span id = "number">823</span><title>恥</title>	<p>Ear 。 。 。 heart。 It is most rare to have the heart at the right、 rather than at the bottom。 Take advantage of this fact when you compose your story。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/恥 ち">チ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/恥 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/恥 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/恥 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/恥は－じる">恥は－じる</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/恥はじ">恥はじ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/恥は－じらう">恥は－じらう</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/恥は－ずかしい">恥は－ずかしい</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/恥">恥</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/恥">恥</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/恥">恥</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/恥">恥</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/恥">恥</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/恥">恥</a>

<span id = "number">858</span><title>力</title>	<p>With a little imagination、 one can see a muscle in this simple、 two－stroke character meaning power。  As a primitive、 either muscle or power can be used。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/力 りょく">リョク</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/力 りき">リキ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/力 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/力 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/力ちから">力ちから</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/力">力</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/力">力</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/力">力</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/力">力</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/力">力</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/力">力</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/力">力</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/力">力</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/力">力</a>

<span id = "number">873</span><title>行</title>	<p>By joining the top four strokes、 you should get a picture of the front current of a river、 the stream trailing behind。 Hence the character for going。  As a primitive、 this character has two forms。 Reduced to the left side only、彳、 it can...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/行 こう">コウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/行 ぎょう">ギョウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/行 あん">アン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/行 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/行い－く">行い－く</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/行ゆ－く">行ゆ－く</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/行おこな－う">行おこな－う</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/行">行</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/行">行</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/行">行</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/行">行</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/行">行</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/行">行</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/行">行</a>

<span id = "number">1016</span><title>久</title>	<p>This character uses the diagonal sweep of the second stroke to double up for bound up and a person。 Think of a mummy、 and the key word will not be far behind。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/久 きゅう">キュウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/久 く">ク</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/久 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/久 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/久ひさ－しい">久ひさ－しい</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/久">久</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/久">久</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/久">久</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/久">久</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/久">久</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/久">久</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/久">久</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/久">久</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/久">久</a>
<span id = "number">1017</span><title>畝</title>	<p>Think of the three kinds of furrows shown here in this character—a top hat’s rim、 a rice field’s ridges、 and the wrinkles that show you’ve been around a long time。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/畝 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/畝 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/畝 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/畝 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/畝うね">畝うね</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/畝">畝</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/畝">畝</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/畝">畝</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/畝">畝</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/畝">畝</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/畝">畝</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/畝">畝</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/畝">畝</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/畝">畝</a>
<span id = "number">1018</span><title>囚</title>	<p>Person 。 。 。 pent in。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/囚 しゅう">シュウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/囚 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/囚 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/囚 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/囚">囚</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/囚">囚</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/囚">囚</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/囚">囚</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/囚">囚</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/囚">囚</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/囚">囚</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/囚">囚</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/囚">囚</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/囚">囚</a>
<span id = "number">1019</span><title>内</title>	<p>Person 。 。 belt。 Note that we cannot use the primitive meaning of hood here because the person runs through the element、 not under it。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/内 ない">ナイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/内 だい">ダイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/内 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/内 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/内うち">内うち</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/内">内</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/内">内</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/内">内</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/内">内</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/内">内</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/内">内</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/内">内</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/内">内</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/内">内</a>
<span id = "number">1020</span><title>丙</title>	<p>Those no－frills flights the airlines off er to attract customers should help create an image from ceiling 。 。 。 person 。 。 。 belt。 The kanji meaning “inside” should not be used because of its proximity to the element for “in。”</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/丙 へい">ヘイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/丙 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/丙 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/丙 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/丙">丙</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/丙">丙</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/丙">丙</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/丙">丙</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/丙">丙</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/丙">丙</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/丙">丙</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/丙">丙</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/丙">丙</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/丙">丙</a>

<span id = "number">1022</span><title>肉</title>	<p>Let this doubling of one of the elements for “inside” yield the sense of “insides” to approach the key word、 meat。 The abbreviated form of this character gave us the primitive meaning of flesh or part of the body for the kanji 月。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肉 にく">ニク</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肉 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肉 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肉 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肉">肉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肉">肉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肉">肉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肉">肉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肉">肉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肉">肉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肉">肉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肉">肉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肉">肉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/肉">肉</a>

<span id = "number">1027</span><title>匁</title>	<p>This character obliges us to use a Japanese key word for want of an English equivalent。 It refers to an old unit of weight、 equal to about 3。75 grams。 The word is only slightly more useful in modern Japanese than cubits and kites are in modern En...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/匁 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/匁 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/匁 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/匁 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/匁">匁</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/匁">匁</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/匁">匁</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/匁">匁</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/匁">匁</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/匁">匁</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/匁">匁</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/匁">匁</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/匁">匁</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/匁">匁</a>
<span id = "number">1028</span><title>以</title>	<p>Picture a person dragging a plow behind、 and the drop of sweat which falls from his brow as he does his work。 Think of him （or her、 for that matter） making a living “by means of the sweat of their brows。”</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/以 い">イ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/以 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/以 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/以 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/以">以</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/以">以</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/以">以</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/以">以</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/以">以</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/以">以</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/以">以</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/以">以</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/以">以</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/以">以</a>
<span id = "number">1029</span><title>似</title>	<p>Be sure to keep this key word distinct from likeness （frame 100）。 Its elements： person 。 。 。 by means of。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/似 じ">ジ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/似 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/似 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/似 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/似に－る">似に－る</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/似">似</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/似">似</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/似">似</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/似">似</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/似">似</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/似">似</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/似">似</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/似">似</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/似">似</a>
<span id = "number">1030</span><title>併</title>	<p>The sense of the key word is one of joining things together that were previously separate。 Its elements： person 。 。 。 puzzle。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/併 へい">ヘイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/併 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/併 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/併 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/併あわ－せる">併あわ－せる</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/併">併</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/併">併</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/併">併</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/併">併</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/併">併</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/併">併</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/併">併</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/併">併</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/併">併</a>

<span id = "number">1033</span><title>宮</title>	<p>Way back in Lesson 2 we learned the character for spine。 The two other characters in which it is used we can now learn together in this and the following frame。 Here a Shinto shrine is composed of house and spine。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/宮 きゅう">キュウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/宮 ぐう">グウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/宮 く">ク</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/宮 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/宮みや">宮みや</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/宮">宮</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/宮">宮</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/宮">宮</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/宮">宮</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/宮">宮</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/宮">宮</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/宮">宮</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/宮">宮</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/宮">宮</a>

<span id = "number">1036</span><title>年</title>	<p>In an odd fashion、 the kanji for year joins together the element for horse、 on the top、 and the right half of the element for sunglasses。 Think of it as a horse wearing sunglasses with one of the lenses popped out。 We will use this latter image...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/年 ねん">ネン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/年 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/年 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/年 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/年とし">年とし</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/年">年</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/年">年</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/年">年</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/年">年</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/年">年</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/年">年</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/年">年</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/年">年</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/年">年</a>
<span id = "number">1037</span><title>夜</title>	<p>First of all、 be sure not to confuse the connotations of night with those of evening （frame 109） and nightbreak （frame 30 旦）。 Its elements： top hat 。 。 person 。 。 。walking legs 。 。 。 drop。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/夜 や">ヤ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/夜 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/夜 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/夜 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/夜よ">夜よ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/夜よる">夜よる</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/夜">夜</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/夜">夜</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/夜">夜</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/夜">夜</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/夜">夜</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/夜">夜</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/夜">夜</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/夜">夜</a>

<span id = "number">1048</span><title>旅</title>	<p>Let the last 4 strokes、 which are also the concluding strokes to the character for garment、 represent a rag as its primitive meaning。 We shall meet this only on one other occasion。 This gives us as our elements： banner 。 。 。 rag。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/旅 りょ">リョ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/旅 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/旅 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/旅 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/旅たび">旅たび</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/旅">旅</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/旅">旅</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/旅">旅</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/旅">旅</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/旅">旅</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/旅">旅</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/旅">旅</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/旅">旅</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/旅">旅</a>
<span id = "number">1049</span><title>勿</title>	<p>First take the primitive meaning of this character： knot。 Think of it as the piglet minus its body （the horizontal stroke）、 that is、 the curly tail that looks like a knot。 As an exception、 we will use the homonym to remember the abstract ...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勿 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勿 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勿 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勿 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勿">勿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勿">勿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勿">勿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勿">勿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勿">勿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勿">勿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勿">勿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勿">勿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勿">勿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勿">勿</a>

<span id = "number">1103</span><title>察</title>	<p>“Guess” here has the sense of a measured conjecture。 Its elements： house 。 。 。 ritual。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/察 さつ">サツ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/察 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/察 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/察 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/察">察</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/察">察</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/察">察</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/察">察</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/察">察</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/察">察</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/察">察</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/察">察</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/察">察</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/察">察</a>

<span id = "number">1105</span><title>由</title>	<p>The “wherefore” of this kanji explains the reason or origin of a thing。 It does this graphically by depicting a seed in a rice field sending up a single sprout、 which is the whole why and wherefore of the seed’s falling in the earth and dying...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/由 ゆ">ユ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/由 ゆう">ユウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/由 ゆい">ユイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/由 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/由よし">由よし</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/由">由</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/由">由</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/由">由</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/由">由</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/由">由</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/由">由</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/由">由</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/由">由</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/由">由</a>

<span id = "number">1113</span><title>甲</title>	<p>This kanji reverses the element for sprout、 giving the image of roots being sent down into the earth by a seed planted in the rice field。 From there you must invent a connection to the key word、 armor。  The primitive meaning is roots。Important ...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/甲 こう">コウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/甲 かん">カン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/甲 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/甲 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/甲">甲</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/甲">甲</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/甲">甲</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/甲">甲</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/甲">甲</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/甲">甲</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/甲">甲</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/甲">甲</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/甲">甲</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/甲">甲</a>
<span id = "number">1114</span><title>押</title>	<p>Fingers 。 。 。 roots。 Compare and contrast with pluck （frame 1106 抽）。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/押 おう">オウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/押 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/押 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/押 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/押お－す">押お－す</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/押お－さえる">押お－さえる</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/押">押</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/押">押</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/押">押</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/押">押</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/押">押</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/押">押</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/押">押</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/押">押</a>
<span id = "number">1115</span><title>岬</title>	<p>Like the cape （frame 153 埼） and the promontory （frame 778 崎）、 the headland refers to a jut of land。 Its elements： mountain 。 。 。 roots。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/岬 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/岬 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/岬 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/岬 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/岬みさき">岬みさき</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/岬">岬</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/岬">岬</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/岬">岬</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/岬">岬</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/岬">岬</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/岬">岬</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/岬">岬</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/岬">岬</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/岬">岬</a>
<span id = "number">1116</span><title>挿</title>	<p>Fingers 。 。 。 thousand 。 。 。 roots。 Observe how the writing order does not follow the elements in order、 because the final stroke is used for two diff erent elements。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/挿 そう">ソウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/挿 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/挿 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/挿 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/挿さ－す">挿さ－す</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/挿">挿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/挿">挿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/挿">挿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/挿">挿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/挿">挿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/挿">挿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/挿">挿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/挿">挿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/挿">挿</a>
<span id = "number">1117</span><title>申</title>	<p>The olde English is used here to indicate a humble form of the third person singular of the verb “to speak。” It is written by a tongue wagging in the mouth with a walking stick rammed through it and coming out at both ends。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/申 しん">シン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/申 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/申 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/申 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/申もう－す">申もう－す</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/申">申</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/申">申</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/申">申</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/申">申</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/申">申</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/申">申</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/申">申</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/申">申</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/申">申</a>

<span id = "number">1121</span><title>果</title>	<p>The final stage of the seed is reached when the plant has reached its full growth （the tree） and comes to fruition、 producing fruit full of new seeds that can return to the earth and start the process all over again。 The main thing to notice here...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/果 か">カ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/果 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/果 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/果 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/果は－たす">果は－たす</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/果は－てる">果は－てる</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/果は－て">果は－て</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/果">果</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/果">果</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/果">果</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/果">果</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/果">果</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/果">果</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/果">果</a>

<span id = "number">1157</span><title>唐</title>	<p>The key word here refers of course to the T’ang Dynasty in China （and not to the name of the drink astronauts take with them into outer space、 though this could be useful for the next frame）。 Its elements： cave 。 。 。 rake 。 。 。 mo...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/唐 とう">トウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/唐 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/唐 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/唐 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/唐から">唐から</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/唐">唐</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/唐">唐</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/唐">唐</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/唐">唐</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/唐">唐</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/唐">唐</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/唐">唐</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/唐">唐</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/唐">唐</a>

<span id = "number">1160</span><title>逮</title>	<p>Think of apprehending criminals。 The elements are： sieve 。 。 。 road。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/逮 たい">タイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/逮 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/逮 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/逮 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/逮">逮</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/逮">逮</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/逮">逮</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/逮">逮</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/逮">逮</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/逮">逮</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/逮">逮</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/逮">逮</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/逮">逮</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/逮">逮</a>
<span id = "number">1161</span><title>伊</title>	<p>Used chiefly in proper names、 and given the sound “i、” this kanji can be remembered as an abbreviation of Italy、 for which it is still used today in Japan。 Its primitives： person 。 。 。 mop。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/伊 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/伊 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/伊 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/伊 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/伊">伊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/伊">伊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/伊">伊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/伊">伊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/伊">伊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/伊">伊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/伊">伊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/伊">伊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/伊">伊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/伊">伊</a>
<span id = "number">1162</span><title>君</title>	<p>The somewhat highbrow British term of address is chosen here to represent the kanji for a form of address used towards one’s juniors。 It is composed of： mop 。 。 。 mouth。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/君 くん">クン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/君 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/君 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/君 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/君きみ">君きみ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/君">君</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/君">君</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/君">君</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/君">君</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/君">君</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/君">君</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/君">君</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/君">君</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/君">君</a>

<span id = "number">1164</span><title>耐</title>	<p>The key word is a suffix used to indicate “safe from” or “protected against、” as in the words rustproof、 waterproof、 and fireproof。 It is composed of： comb 。 。 。 glue。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/耐 たい">タイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/耐 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/耐 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/耐 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/耐た－える">耐た－える</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/耐">耐</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/耐">耐</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/耐">耐</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/耐">耐</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/耐">耐</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/耐">耐</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/耐">耐</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/耐">耐</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/耐">耐</a>
<span id = "number">1165</span><title>需</title>	<p>The sense of demand is best captured by thinking of the economic principle of “supply and demand。” The primitives： rain 。 。 。 comb。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/需 じゅ">ジュ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/需 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/需 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/需 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/需">需</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/需">需</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/需">需</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/需">需</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/需">需</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/需">需</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/需">需</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/需">需</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/需">需</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/需">需</a>

<span id = "number">1168</span><title>両</title>	<p>Ceiling 。 。 。 belt 。 。 。 mountain。 Note that the writing order follows the order in which the primitives are given here。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/両 りょう">リョウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/両 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/両 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/両 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/両">両</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/両">両</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/両">両</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/両">両</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/両">両</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/両">両</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/両">両</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/両">両</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/両">両</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/両">両</a>
<span id = "number">1169</span><title>満</title>	<p>Water 。 。 。 flowers 。 。 。 both。 Given the abstract nature of this last primitive、 you may want to borrow the image from the previous frame。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/満 まん">マン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/満 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/満 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/満 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/満み－ちる">満み－ちる</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/満み－たす">満み－たす</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/満">満</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/満">満</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/満">満</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/満">満</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/満">満</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/満">満</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/満">満</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/満">満</a>
<span id = "number">1170</span><title>画</title>	<p>In forming an image for the key word、 it is helpful to know that this kanji is used for artistic representations such as completed paintings、 as well as for the number of brush－strokes in a character （as、 for instance、 in Indexes ii and iii a...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/画 が">ガ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/画 かく">カク</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/画 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/画 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/画">画</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/画">画</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/画">画</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/画">画</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/画">画</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/画">画</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/画">画</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/画">画</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/画">画</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/画">画</a>

<span id = "number">1187</span><title>惜</title>	<p>State of mind 。 。 。 once upon a time。 The sense of the key word is that of a lost opportunity or bad turn of aff airs、 as in the phrase “What a pity！”</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/惜 せき">セキ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/惜 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/惜 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/惜 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/惜お－しい">惜お－しい</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/惜お－しむ">惜お－しむ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/惜">惜</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/惜">惜</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/惜">惜</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/惜">惜</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/惜">惜</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/惜">惜</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/惜">惜</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/惜">惜</a>

<span id = "number">1190</span><title>廿</title>	<p>The two tens joined at the bottom by a short line is actually the old character for twenty、 which we might as well learn since we need its primitive form。 It is written the same as salad、 except for the shorter final stroke。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/廿 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/廿 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/廿 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/廿 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/廿">廿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/廿">廿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/廿">廿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/廿">廿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/廿">廿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/廿">廿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/廿">廿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/廿">廿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/廿">廿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/廿">廿</a>

<span id = "number">1198</span><title>墳</title>	<p>Soil 。 。 。 haystack 。 。 。 clams。 In order not to confuse this kanji with that for a grave （frame 231 墓）、 something like the image of an Egyptian tomb should be adopted、 with all its special connotations。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/墳 ふん">フン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/墳 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/墳 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/墳 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/墳">墳</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/墳">墳</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/墳">墳</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/墳">墳</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/墳">墳</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/墳">墳</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/墳">墳</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/墳">墳</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/墳">墳</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/墳">墳</a>

<span id = "number">1202</span><title>半</title>	<p>Although the writing order is diff erent、 one can remember the appearance of this character by seeing it as a little needle—the kind used for splitting hairs in half。 （Again、 according to rule、 little takes a stroke beneath it in order to be ...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/半 はん">ハン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/半 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/半 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/半 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/半なか－ば">半なか－ば</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/半">半</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/半">半</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/半">半</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/半">半</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/半">半</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/半">半</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/半">半</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/半">半</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/半">半</a>
<span id = "number">1203</span><title>伴</title>	<p>Person 。 。 。 half。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/伴 はん">ハン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/伴 ばん">バン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/伴 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/伴 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/伴ともな－う">伴ともな－う</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/伴">伴</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/伴">伴</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/伴">伴</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/伴">伴</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/伴">伴</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/伴">伴</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/伴">伴</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/伴">伴</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/伴">伴</a>
<span id = "number">1204</span><title>畔</title>	<p>Rice field 。 。 。 half。 The key word here refers to the ridges that rise up between the sections of a rice paddy。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/畔 はん">ハン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/畔 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/畔 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/畔 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/畔">畔</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/畔">畔</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/畔">畔</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/畔">畔</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/畔">畔</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/畔">畔</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/畔">畔</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/畔">畔</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/畔">畔</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/畔">畔</a>
<span id = "number">1205</span><title>判</title>	<p>Half 。 。 。 saber。 You might recall the famous judgment of King Solomon、 who off ered to slice a baby in two with a saber to give half to each of the mothers who claimed it as her own。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/判 はん">ハン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/判 ばん">バン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/判 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/判 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/判">判</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/判">判</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/判">判</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/判">判</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/判">判</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/判">判</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/判">判</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/判">判</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/判">判</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/判">判</a>
<span id = "number">1206</span><title>券</title>	<p>Quarter 。 。 。 dagger。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/券 けん">ケン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/券 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/券 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/券 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/券">券</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/券">券</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/券">券</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/券">券</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/券">券</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/券">券</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/券">券</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/券">券</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/券">券</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/券">券</a>
<span id = "number">1207</span><title>巻</title>	<p>Quarter 。 。 。 snake。 The key word refers to a manuscript rolled up into a scroll、 not to a hanging scroll （frame 407 幅）。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/巻 かん">カン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/巻 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/巻 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/巻 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/巻ま－く">巻ま－く</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/巻まき">巻まき</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/巻">巻</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/巻">巻</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/巻">巻</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/巻">巻</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/巻">巻</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/巻">巻</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/巻">巻</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/巻">巻</a>
<span id = "number">1208</span><title>圏</title>	<p>This key word refers to a realm or orbit、 not to a ball。 Its elements： pent in 。 。 。 scroll。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/圏 けん">ケン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/圏 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/圏 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/圏 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/圏">圏</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/圏">圏</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/圏">圏</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/圏">圏</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/圏">圏</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/圏">圏</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/圏">圏</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/圏">圏</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/圏">圏</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/圏">圏</a>

<span id = "number">1211</span><title>謄</title>	<p>Moon 。 。 。 quarter 。 。 。 words。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/謄 とう">トウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/謄 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/謄 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/謄 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/謄">謄</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/謄">謄</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/謄">謄</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/謄">謄</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/謄">謄</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/謄">謄</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/謄">謄</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/謄">謄</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/謄">謄</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/謄">謄</a>
<span id = "number">1212</span><title>片</title>	<p>This kanji is based on the pictograph of a tree with some branches going upwards and others hanging down、 split right down the middle。 When that picture’s right side is isolated、 it becomes the kanji for one－sided、 in the sense of only one pa...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/片 へん">ヘン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/片 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/片 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/片 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/片かた">片かた</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/片">片</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/片">片</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/片">片</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/片">片</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/片">片</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/片">片</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/片">片</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/片">片</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/片">片</a>
<span id = "number">1213</span><title>版</title>	<p>Although this character also carries the sense of an “edition” of a publication、 the elements、 one－sided and anti－、 more readily suggest its other meaning of a printing block。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/版 はん">ハン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/版 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/版 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/版 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/版">版</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/版">版</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/版">版</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/版">版</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/版">版</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/版">版</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/版">版</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/版">版</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/版">版</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/版">版</a>
<span id = "number">1214</span><title>之</title>	<p>This character is now used chiefly in proper names、 and is best learned as the character closest to the hiragana え、 though in fact it has no relation to it。  In order to give this kanji a more concrete meaning when it is used as a primitive eleme...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/之 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/之 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/之 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/之 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/之">之</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/之">之</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/之">之</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/之">之</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/之">之</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/之">之</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/之">之</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/之">之</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/之">之</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/之">之</a>
<span id = "number">1215</span><title>乏</title>	<p>Drop of 。 。 。 building blocks。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/乏 ぼう">ボウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/乏 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/乏 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/乏 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/乏とぼ－しい">乏とぼ－しい</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/乏">乏</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/乏">乏</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/乏">乏</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/乏">乏</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/乏">乏</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/乏">乏</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/乏">乏</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/乏">乏</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/乏">乏</a>

<span id = "number">1217</span><title>不</title>	<p>You may play with the primitives of this kanji as you wish （ceiling 。 。 。 person 。 。 。 a drop of）、 but you will probably find that its simplicity、 and its frequency、 make it easy to remember just as it is。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/不 ふ">フ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/不 ぶ">ブ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/不 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/不 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/不">不</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/不">不</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/不">不</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/不">不</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/不">不</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/不">不</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/不">不</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/不">不</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/不">不</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/不">不</a>
<span id = "number">1218</span><title>否</title>	<p>Negative 。 。 。 mouth。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/否 ひ">ヒ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/否 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/否 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/否 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/否いな">否いな</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/否">否</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/否">否</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/否">否</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/否">否</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/否">否</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/否">否</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/否">否</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/否">否</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/否">否</a>
<span id = "number">1219</span><title>杯</title>	<p>Tree 。 。 。 negative。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/杯 はい">ハイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/杯 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/杯 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/杯 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/杯さかずき">杯さかずき</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/杯">杯</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/杯">杯</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/杯">杯</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/杯">杯</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/杯">杯</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/杯">杯</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/杯">杯</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/杯">杯</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/杯">杯</a>
<span id = "number">1220</span><title>矢</title>	<p>When shot high into the heavens、 the dart gets so small it looks like a mere drop。 Although this character could as well mean “arrow、” it has no connection with the primitive of that meaning。 Hence the new key word。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/矢 し">シ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/矢 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/矢 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/矢 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/矢や">矢や</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/矢">矢</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/矢">矢</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/矢">矢</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/矢">矢</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/矢">矢</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/矢">矢</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/矢">矢</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/矢">矢</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/矢">矢</a>
<span id = "number">1221</span><title>矯</title>	<p>Dart 。 。 。 angel。 Compare your stories for correct （frame 379 正）、 revise （frame 339 訂）、 and reformation （frame 528 改）。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/矯 きょう">キョウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/矯 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/矯 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/矯 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/矯た－める">矯た－める</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/矯">矯</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/矯">矯</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/矯">矯</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/矯">矯</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/矯">矯</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/矯">矯</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/矯">矯</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/矯">矯</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/矯">矯</a>

<span id = "number">1231</span><title>弓</title>	<p>This character pictures the bent wooden bow。 Later we will learn how to make the bowstring that goes with it （frame 1386 弦）。 If you stretch this character out and see the indentation on the left as its handle、 the pictography should be cleare...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/弓 きゅう">キュウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/弓 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/弓 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/弓 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/弓ゆみ">弓ゆみ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/弓">弓</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/弓">弓</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/弓">弓</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/弓">弓</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/弓">弓</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/弓">弓</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/弓">弓</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/弓">弓</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/弓">弓</a>

<span id = "number">1236</span><title>弱</title>	<p>Two bows 。 。 with ice on them。  dollar sign 弗 Composed of two walking sticks running through a bow、 this character is infrequent as a primitive、 and yet easy to remember for what it looks like （which is also what the Japanese adopted it to ...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/弱 じゃく">ジャク</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/弱 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/弱 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/弱 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/弱よわ－い">弱よわ－い</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/弱よわ－る">弱よわ－る</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/弱よわ－まる">弱よわ－まる</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/弱よわ－める">弱よわ－める</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/弱">弱</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/弱">弱</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/弱">弱</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/弱">弱</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/弱">弱</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/弱">弱</a>

<span id = "number">1246</span><title>与</title>	<p>Slingshot 。 。 。 one。 Later on we shall learn the character for give （frame 1897 呉）、 but even at this point it is a good idea to distinguish this key word from impart （frame 736 授） and grant （frame 1052 賜）。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/与 よ">ヨ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/与 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/与 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/与 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/与あた－える">与あた－える</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/与">与</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/与">与</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/与">与</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/与">与</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/与">与</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/与">与</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/与">与</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/与">与</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/与">与</a>

<span id = "number">1248</span><title>身</title>	<p>The key word somebody was chosen to convey the double meaning of this kanji： body and person。 Its composition is based on the nose （which、 you will recall、 is also the kanji for oneself）。 The extension of the bottom and far right strokes of...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/身 しん">シン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/身 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/身 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/身 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/身み">身み</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/身">身</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/身">身</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/身">身</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/身">身</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/身">身</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/身">身</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/身">身</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/身">身</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/身">身</a>
<span id = "number">1249</span><title>射</title>	<p>“I shot an arrow into the air、 And it landed I know not where” goes the poem。 （The poor poet obviously loses a lot of arrows。） This kanji、 however、 tells us where it did land。 Its elements： somebody 。 。 。 glued to。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/射 しゃ">シャ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/射 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/射 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/射 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/射い－る">射い－る</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/射">射</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/射">射</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/射">射</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/射">射</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/射">射</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/射">射</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/射">射</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/射">射</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/射">射</a>

<span id = "number">1271</span><title>官</title>	<p>By replacing the maestro’s baton （the drop） with the roof of a house、 we have his equivalent in the institutional world of big government： the bureaucrat。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/官 かん">カン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/官 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/官 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/官 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/官">官</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/官">官</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/官">官</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/官">官</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/官">官</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/官">官</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/官">官</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/官">官</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/官">官</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/官">官</a>

<span id = "number">1274</span><title>父</title>	<p>The kindness and hard work of the ideal father is seen in this abbreviation of the taskmaster that leaves off his rod or whip （the first stroke） and replaces it with the sweat of the father’s brow （the two drops at the top）。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/父 ふ">フ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/父 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/父 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/父 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/父ちち">父ちち</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/父">父</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/父">父</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/父">父</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/父">父</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/父">父</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/父">父</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/父">父</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/父">父</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/父">父</a>

<span id = "number">1381</span><title>幾</title>	<p>Two cocoons 。 。 。 person 。 。 。 fiesta。  As a primitive、 this kanji will mean an abacus、 the beadinstrument used in the Orient to calculate how many。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幾 き">キ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幾 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幾 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幾 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幾いく">幾いく</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幾">幾</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幾">幾</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幾">幾</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幾">幾</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幾">幾</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幾">幾</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幾">幾</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幾">幾</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/幾">幾</a>

<span id = "number">1387</span><title>擁</title>	<p>Fingers 。 。 。 mysterious 。 。 。 turkey。 Note that the top hat is extended across both elements、 though it belongs only to the cocoon。 This means that you may either use mysterious—as we did here—or take the three elements separately。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/擁 よう">ヨウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/擁 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/擁 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/擁 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/擁">擁</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/擁">擁</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/擁">擁</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/擁">擁</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/擁">擁</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/擁">擁</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/擁">擁</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/擁">擁</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/擁">擁</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/擁">擁</a>
<span id = "number">1388</span><title>滋</title>	<p>Water 。 。 。 double－mysterious。 Note the doubling up of the element for top hat in the primitive for mysterious and assign it a special image、 as it will come up in the next two frames。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滋 じ">ジ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滋 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滋 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滋 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滋">滋</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滋">滋</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滋">滋</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滋">滋</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滋">滋</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滋">滋</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滋">滋</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滋">滋</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滋">滋</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/滋">滋</a>
<span id = "number">1389</span><title>慈</title>	<p>Double－mysterious 。 。 。 heart。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/慈 じ">ジ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/慈 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/慈 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/慈 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/慈いつく－しむ">慈いつく－しむ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/慈">慈</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/慈">慈</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/慈">慈</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/慈">慈</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/慈">慈</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/慈">慈</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/慈">慈</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/慈">慈</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/慈">慈</a>
