<span id = "number">1391</span><title>系</title>	<p>The single stroke added to the beginning of the primitive for thread gives the image of threads woven into a single cord。 Hence the meaning、 lineage。  As a primitive、 we shall give this kanji the meaning of yarn、 as the uniting of many threads ...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/系 けい">ケイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/系 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/系 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/系 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/系">系</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/系">系</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/系">系</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/系">系</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/系">系</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/系">系</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/系">系</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/系">系</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/系">系</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/系">系</a>

<span id = "number">1396</span><title>脚</title>	<p>Part of the body 。 。 。 instead。 This character has more or less the same meaning as that for legs learned back in frame 1279 足。 It can also indicate the part of the legs from the shins down、 which explains the choice of the key word。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/脚 きゃく">キャク</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/脚 きゃ">キャ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/脚 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/脚 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/脚あし">脚あし</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/脚">脚</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/脚">脚</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/脚">脚</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/脚">脚</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/脚">脚</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/脚">脚</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/脚">脚</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/脚">脚</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/脚">脚</a>

<span id = "number">1424</span><title>貿</title>	<p>Receipt 。 。 。 dagger 。 。 。 shells。 Do not confuse with make a deal （frame 439 商） or wholesale （frame 1397 卸）。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/貿 ぼう">ボウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/貿 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/貿 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/貿 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/貿">貿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/貿">貿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/貿">貿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/貿">貿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/貿">貿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/貿">貿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/貿">貿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/貿">貿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/貿">貿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/貿">貿</a>
<span id = "number">1425</span><title>印</title>	<p>At last we come to the general character meaning stamp。 Its elements： staples 。 。 。 stamp。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/印 いん">イン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/印 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/印 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/印 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/印しるし">印しるし</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/印">印</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/印">印</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/印">印</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/印">印</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/印">印</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/印">印</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/印">印</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/印">印</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/印">印</a>
<span id = "number">1426</span><title>興</title>	<p>Here we see a wheel of fortune that has been tampered with。 On both sides you see the staples separating one number’s slot from the next、 and between them the character for the same— indicating that it has been rigged to repeat the same number。...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/興 こう">コウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/興 きょう">キョウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/興 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/興 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/興おこ－る">興おこ－る</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/興おこ－す">興おこ－す</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/興">興</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/興">興</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/興">興</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/興">興</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/興">興</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/興">興</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/興">興</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/興">興</a>
<span id = "number">1427</span><title>酉</title>	<p>Though we shall later encounter the kanji for bird、 we introduce this one for the tenth sign of the zodiac mainly because of its use as a primitive、 where it has a diff erent meaning。  As a primitive、 it means whiskey bottle。 In its pictograph...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/酉 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/酉 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/酉 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/酉 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/酉">酉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/酉">酉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/酉">酉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/酉">酉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/酉">酉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/酉">酉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/酉">酉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/酉">酉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/酉">酉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/酉">酉</a>

<span id = "number">1440</span><title>豆</title>	<p>This kanji depicts a pot of beans、 although it looks more like a table on which the pot is resting。  As a primitive、 this kanji will also mean table。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/豆 とう">トウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/豆 ず">ズ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/豆 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/豆 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/豆まめ">豆まめ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/豆">豆</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/豆">豆</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/豆">豆</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/豆">豆</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/豆">豆</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/豆">豆</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/豆">豆</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/豆">豆</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/豆">豆</a>
<span id = "number">1441</span><title>頭</title>	<p>Here we meet at last the full kanji on which the primitive for head is based。 The elements： table 。 。 。 head。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/頭 とう">トウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/頭 ず">ズ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/頭 と">ト</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/頭 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/頭あたま">頭あたま</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/頭かしら">頭かしら</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/頭">頭</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/頭">頭</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/頭">頭</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/頭">頭</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/頭">頭</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/頭">頭</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/頭">頭</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/頭">頭</a>
<span id = "number">1442</span><title>短</title>	<p>Dart 。 。 。 table。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/短 たん">タン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/短 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/短 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/短 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/短みじか－い">短みじか－い</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/短">短</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/短">短</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/短">短</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/短">短</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/短">短</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/短">短</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/短">短</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/短">短</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/短">短</a>
<span id = "number">1443</span><title>豊</title>	<p>Bend 。 。 。 table。 Think of a bountiful harvest、 and you will not be far from the meaning of this character。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/豊 ほう">ホウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/豊 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/豊 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/豊 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/豊ゆた－か">豊ゆた－か</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/豊">豊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/豊">豊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/豊">豊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/豊">豊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/豊">豊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/豊">豊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/豊">豊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/豊">豊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/豊">豊</a>
<span id = "number">1444</span><title>鼓</title>	<p>The full kanji for the drum adds a branch、 apparently to serve as a drumstick、 to the primitive for drum。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鼓 こ">コ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鼓 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鼓 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鼓 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鼓つづみ">鼓つづみ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鼓">鼓</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鼓">鼓</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鼓">鼓</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鼓">鼓</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鼓">鼓</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鼓">鼓</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鼓">鼓</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鼓">鼓</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/鼓">鼓</a>
<span id = "number">1445</span><title>喜</title>	<p>Drum 。 。 。 mouth。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/喜 き">キ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/喜 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/喜 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/喜 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/喜よろこ－ぶ">喜よろこ－ぶ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/喜">喜</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/喜">喜</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/喜">喜</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/喜">喜</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/喜">喜</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/喜">喜</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/喜">喜</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/喜">喜</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/喜">喜</a>
<span id = "number">1446</span><title>樹</title>	<p>Trees 。 。 。 drum 。 。 。 glue。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/樹 じゅ">ジュ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/樹 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/樹 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/樹 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/樹">樹</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/樹">樹</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/樹">樹</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/樹">樹</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/樹">樹</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/樹">樹</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/樹">樹</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/樹">樹</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/樹">樹</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/樹">樹</a>
<span id = "number">1447</span><title>皿</title>	<p>The kanji for a dish is、 clearly、 the pictograph of a painted or carved bowl、 seen from the side。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/皿 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/皿 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/皿 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/皿 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/皿さら">皿さら</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/皿">皿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/皿">皿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/皿">皿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/皿">皿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/皿">皿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/皿">皿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/皿">皿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/皿">皿</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/皿">皿</a>
<span id = "number">1448</span><title>血</title>	<p>The drop in the dish is blood。 It is similar to the drop we saw earlier on the dagger in the character for blade （frame 84）。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/血 けつ">ケツ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/血 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/血 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/血 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/血ち">血ち</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/血">血</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/血">血</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/血">血</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/血">血</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/血">血</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/血">血</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/血">血</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/血">血</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/血">血</a>

<span id = "number">1457</span><title>盛</title>	<p>Here boom refers to something that is popular and prospering。 Its elements： turn into 。 。 。 dish。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/盛 せい">セイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/盛 じょう">ジョウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/盛 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/盛 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/盛も－る">盛も－る</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/盛さか－る">盛さか－る</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/盛さか－ん">盛さか－ん</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/盛">盛</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/盛">盛</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/盛">盛</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/盛">盛</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/盛">盛</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/盛">盛</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/盛">盛</a>

<span id = "number">1484</span><title>平</title>	<p>This character is easiest remembered as a pictograph of a water lily floating on the surface of the water、 which gives it its meaning of even。 The fourth stroke represents the calm、 smooth surface of a pond、 and the final stroke the long stem of ...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/平 へい">ヘイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/平 びょう">ビョウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/平 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/平 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/平たい－ら">平たい－ら</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/平ひら">平ひら</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/平">平</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/平">平</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/平">平</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/平">平</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/平">平</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/平">平</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/平">平</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/平">平</a>

<span id = "number">1543</span><title>積</title>	<p>Wheat 。 。 。 blame。 This key word has to do with measurement、 and should be kept distinct from the kanji for quantity （frame 177 量）—even though the meanings are similar。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/積 せき">セキ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/積 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/積 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/積 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/積つ－む">積つ－む</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/積つ－もる">積つ－もる</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/積">積</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/積">積</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/積">積</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/積">積</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/積">積</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/積">積</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/積">積</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/積">積</a>
<span id = "number">1544</span><title>債</title>	<p>Person 。 。 。 blame。 The key word refers to financial bonds。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/債 さい">サイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/債 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/債 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/債 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/債">債</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/債">債</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/債">債</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/債">債</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/債">債</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/債">債</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/債">債</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/債">債</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/債">債</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/債">債</a>
<span id = "number">1545</span><title>漬</title>	<p>Water 。 。 。 blame。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/漬 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/漬 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/漬 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/漬 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/漬つ－ける">漬つ－ける</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/漬つ－かる">漬つ－かる</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/漬">漬</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/漬">漬</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/漬">漬</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/漬">漬</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/漬">漬</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/漬">漬</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/漬">漬</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/漬">漬</a>
<span id = "number">1546</span><title>表</title>	<p>Grow up 。 。 。 scarf。 This character represents the “outside” of a garment、 just as the kanji for back （frame 399 裏） depicted the “inside” or lining。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/表 ひょう">ヒョウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/表 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/表 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/表 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/表おもて">表おもて</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/表あらわ－す">表あらわ－す</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/表あらわ－れる">表あらわ－れる</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/表">表</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/表">表</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/表">表</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/表">表</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/表">表</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/表">表</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/表">表</a>
<span id = "number">1547</span><title>俵</title>	<p>Keep this kanji distinct from that for sack （frame 1006 袋）。 Its elements are： person 。 。 。 surface。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/俵 ひょう">ヒョウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/俵 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/俵 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/俵 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/俵たわら">俵たわら</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/俵">俵</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/俵">俵</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/俵">俵</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/俵">俵</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/俵">俵</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/俵">俵</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/俵">俵</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/俵">俵</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/俵">俵</a>

<span id = "number">1552</span><title>轄</title>	<p>Car 。 。 。 harm。 Hint： the image of an auto going “out of control” may help keep this key word distinct from others like it、 such as manipulate （frame 801 掌）。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/轄 かつ">カツ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/轄 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/轄 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/轄 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/轄">轄</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/轄">轄</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/轄">轄</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/轄">轄</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/轄">轄</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/轄">轄</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/轄">轄</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/轄">轄</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/轄">轄</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/轄">轄</a>

<span id = "number">1554</span><title>憲</title>	<p>The key word refers to the fundamental guiding principles of a government or other organization。 Its elements： House 。 。 。 grow up 。 。 。 eyes 。 。 。 heart。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/憲 けん">ケン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/憲 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/憲 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/憲 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/憲">憲</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/憲">憲</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/憲">憲</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/憲">憲</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/憲">憲</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/憲">憲</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/憲">憲</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/憲">憲</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/憲">憲</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/憲">憲</a>
<span id = "number">1555</span><title>生</title>	<p>A single drop added to the element for grow up gives us the character for life。  As a primitive、 we may think of a microscopic cell、 that miraculous unit that grows up to become a living being。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/生 せい">セイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/生 しょう">ショウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/生 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/生 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/生い－きる">生い－きる</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/生い－かす">生い－かす</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/生い－ける">生い－ける</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/生う－まれる">生う－まれる</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/生う－む">生う－む</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/生お－う">生お－う</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/生は－える">生は－える</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/生は－やす">生は－やす</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/生き">生き</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/生なま">生なま</a>

<span id = "number">1587</span><title>今</title>	<p>The final stroke of this kanji is a rare shape、 which we have not met before and will only meet in this character and others that include it as a primitive。 We are more accustomed to seeing it straightened out as part of other shapes—for instance...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/今 こん">コン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/今 きん">キン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/今 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/今 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/今いま">今いま</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/今">今</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/今">今</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/今">今</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/今">今</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/今">今</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/今">今</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/今">今</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/今">今</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/今">今</a>

<span id = "number">1592</span><title>陰</title>	<p>Just as the sunshine （frame 1300 陽） represents the masculine principle in nature （Yang）、 the shade stands for the feminine principle （Yin）。 Its elements are： pinnacle 。 。 。 clock 。 。 。 rising cloud。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/陰 いん">イン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/陰 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/陰 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/陰 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/陰かげ">陰かげ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/陰かげ－る">陰かげ－る</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/陰">陰</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/陰">陰</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/陰">陰</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/陰">陰</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/陰">陰</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/陰">陰</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/陰">陰</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/陰">陰</a>
<span id = "number">1593</span><title>予</title>	<p>Think of this character as identical to the halberd （frame 1225 矛） except that the final stroke has been omitted。 Return to that character and devise some image to take this diff erence into account。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/予 よ">ヨ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/予 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/予 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/予 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/予">予</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/予">予</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/予">予</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/予">予</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/予">予</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/予">予</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/予">予</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/予">予</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/予">予</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/予">予</a>

<span id = "number">1629</span><title>闘</title>	<p>Gates 。 。 。 table 。 。 。 glue。 Do not confuse with contend （frame 1154 争）。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/闘 とう">トウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/闘 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/闘 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/闘 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/闘たたか－う">闘たたか－う</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/闘">闘</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/闘">闘</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/闘">闘</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/闘">闘</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/闘">闘</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/闘">闘</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/闘">闘</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/闘">闘</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/闘">闘</a>
<span id = "number">1630</span><title>倉</title>	<p>The single gate is used here not in order to represent one gate、 but many of them、 indeed a meeting of gates。 Add mouth （as an entrance here） and you end up with godown。 That should help keep this character distinct from warehouse （frame 58...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/倉 そう">ソウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/倉 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/倉 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/倉 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/倉くら">倉くら</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/倉">倉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/倉">倉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/倉">倉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/倉">倉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/倉">倉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/倉">倉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/倉">倉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/倉">倉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/倉">倉</a>

<span id = "number">1632</span><title>非</title>	<p>This key word、 a negating prefix、 is a doodle of a heavy iron pole with bars extending in both directions、 to create the picture of a jail cell。 From there to “un－” is but a short step。  As a primitive、 we shall draw on the explanation ...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/非 ひ">ヒ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/非 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/非 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/非 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/非">非</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/非">非</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/非">非</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/非">非</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/非">非</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/非">非</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/非">非</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/非">非</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/非">非</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/非">非</a>
<span id = "number">1633</span><title>俳</title>	<p>This character is used for the haiku、 the 17－syllable poem that is one of Japan’s best－known literary forms。 Its elements： person 。 。 。 jail cell。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/俳 はい">ハイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/俳 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/俳 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/俳 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/俳">俳</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/俳">俳</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/俳">俳</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/俳">俳</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/俳">俳</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/俳">俳</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/俳">俳</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/俳">俳</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/俳">俳</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/俳">俳</a>

<span id = "number">1646</span><title>衛</title>	<p>Boulevard 。 。 。 locket。 Do not confuse with ward off （frame 1302 防）、 protect （frame 997 保）、 guard （frame 186 守）、 or safeguard （frame 700 護）。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衛 えい">エイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衛 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衛 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衛 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衛">衛</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衛">衛</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衛">衛</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衛">衛</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衛">衛</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衛">衛</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衛">衛</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衛">衛</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衛">衛</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衛">衛</a>
<span id = "number">1647</span><title>韓</title>	<p>As with Italy （frame 1161 伊） and Africa （frame 1295 阿）、 this character simply abbreviates the full name of Korea。 Its elements： mist 。 。 。 locket。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/韓 かん">カン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/韓 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/韓 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/韓 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/韓">韓</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/韓">韓</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/韓">韓</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/韓">韓</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/韓">韓</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/韓">韓</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/韓">韓</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/韓">韓</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/韓">韓</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/韓">韓</a>
<span id = "number">1648</span><title>干</title>	<p>It is best to see this kanji as a pictograph of a revolving circular clothesline （viewed from the side）。 Spin it around quickly in your mind’s eye to give it the connotation of to dry。  The primitive meaning is clothesline。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/干 かん">カン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/干 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/干 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/干 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/干ほ－す">干ほ－す</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/干ひ－る">干ひ－る</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/干">干</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/干">干</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/干">干</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/干">干</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/干">干</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/干">干</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/干">干</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/干">干</a>

<span id = "number">1660</span><title>叙</title>	<p>Scale 。 。 crotch。 The key word has to do with conferring ranks、 titles、 and awards。 It should not be confused with bestow （frame 1246 与） or impart （frame 736 授）。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/叙 じょ">ジョ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/叙 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/叙 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/叙 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/叙">叙</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/叙">叙</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/叙">叙</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/叙">叙</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/叙">叙</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/叙">叙</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/叙">叙</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/叙">叙</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/叙">叙</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/叙">叙</a>

<span id = "number">1667</span><title>勅</title>	<p>In order to keep this character distinct from that for an imperial edict （frame 342 詔）、 we must draw again on a pun。 Think of the order here as a mail order or an order of pizza phoned in by the Emperor for delivery to the imperial palace。 Th...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勅 ちょく">チョク</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勅 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勅 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勅 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勅">勅</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勅">勅</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勅">勅</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勅">勅</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勅">勅</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勅">勅</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勅">勅</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勅">勅</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勅">勅</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勅">勅</a>

<span id = "number">1677</span><title>勲</title>	<p>Move 。 。 。 oven fire。 So as not to confuse this kanji with the general character for merit （frame 1276 効）、 you may associate the key word with military decorations and medals of distinction、 both of which it is used for。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勲 くん">クン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勲 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勲 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勲 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勲">勲</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勲">勲</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勲">勲</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勲">勲</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勲">勲</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勲">勲</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勲">勲</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勲">勲</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勲">勲</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勲">勲</a>

<span id = "number">1696</span><title>区</title>	<p>The ward referred to here is a subdivision of a large city。 Its elements： box 。 。 。 sheaves。 When used as a primitive element、 it may be helpful at times to break it up into these same composite elements。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/区 く">ク</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/区 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/区 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/区 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/区">区</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/区">区</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/区">区</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/区">区</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/区">区</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/区">区</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/区">区</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/区">区</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/区">区</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/区">区</a>

<span id = "number">1701</span><title>仰</title>	<p>This character is used both for lying on one’s back faceup、 and for looking up to someone with respect and awe。 Its elements： person 。 。 。 box 。 。 。 stamps。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/仰 ぎょう">ギョウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/仰 こう">コウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/仰 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/仰 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/仰あお－ぐ">仰あお－ぐ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/仰おお－せ">仰おお－せ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/仰">仰</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/仰">仰</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/仰">仰</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/仰">仰</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/仰">仰</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/仰">仰</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/仰">仰</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/仰">仰</a>

<span id = "number">1765</span><title>期</title>	<p>Bushel basket 。 。 。 month。 As the month indicates、 this has to do with periods of time。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/期 き">キ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/期 ご">ゴ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/期 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/期 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/期">期</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/期">期</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/期">期</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/期">期</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/期">期</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/期">期</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/期">期</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/期">期</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/期">期</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/期">期</a>
<span id = "number">1766</span><title>碁</title>	<p>Bushel basket 。 。 。 stones。 The key word refers to the Japanese game played with black and white colored stones on a lined board。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/碁 ご">ゴ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/碁 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/碁 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/碁 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/碁">碁</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/碁">碁</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/碁">碁</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/碁">碁</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/碁">碁</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/碁">碁</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/碁">碁</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/碁">碁</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/碁">碁</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/碁">碁</a>
<span id = "number">1767</span><title>基</title>	<p>Bushel basket 。 。 。 soil。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/基 き">キ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/基 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/基 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/基 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/基もと">基もと</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/基もとい">基もとい</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/基">基</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/基">基</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/基">基</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/基">基</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/基">基</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/基">基</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/基">基</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/基">基</a>
<span id = "number">1768</span><title>甚</title>	<p>Bushel basket 。 。 。 equal。 Note how the first stroke of equal doubles up with the sixth stroke of the bushel basket、 and how the animal legs of the bushel basket are dropped to make room for the human legs of equal。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/甚 じん">ジン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/甚 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/甚 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/甚 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/甚はなは－だ">甚はなは－だ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/甚はなは－だしい">甚はなは－だしい</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/甚">甚</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/甚">甚</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/甚">甚</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/甚">甚</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/甚">甚</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/甚">甚</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/甚">甚</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/甚">甚</a>
<span id = "number">1769</span><title>勘</title>	<p>Tremendously 。 。 。 muscle。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勘 かん">カン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勘 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勘 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勘 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勘">勘</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勘">勘</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勘">勘</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勘">勘</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勘">勘</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勘">勘</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勘">勘</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勘">勘</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勘">勘</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/勘">勘</a>
<span id = "number">1770</span><title>堪</title>	<p>Soil 。 。 。 tremendously。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/堪 かん">カン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/堪 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/堪 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/堪 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/堪た－える">堪た－える</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/堪">堪</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/堪">堪</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/堪">堪</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/堪">堪</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/堪">堪</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/堪">堪</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/堪">堪</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/堪">堪</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/堪">堪</a>
<span id = "number">1771</span><title>貴</title>	<p>Purse 。 。 。 shells。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/貴 き">キ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/貴 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/貴 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/貴 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/貴たっと－い">貴たっと－い</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/貴とうと－い">貴とうと－い</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/貴たっと－ぶ">貴たっと－ぶ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/貴とうと－ぶ">貴とうと－ぶ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/貴">貴</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/貴">貴</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/貴">貴</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/貴">貴</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/貴">貴</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/貴">貴</a>
<span id = "number">1772</span><title>遺</title>	<p>Precious 。 。 。 road。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遺 い">イ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遺 ゆい">ユイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遺 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遺 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遺">遺</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遺">遺</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遺">遺</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遺">遺</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遺">遺</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遺">遺</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遺">遺</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遺">遺</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遺">遺</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遺">遺</a>
<span id = "number">1773</span><title>遣</title>	<p>This kanji takes away the maestro’s baton and replaces it with a purse。 The road represents his being dispatched on his way as an obvious misfit。 You will remember that when he did have his baton、 he was being chased down the road by his fans。 ...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遣 けん">ケン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遣 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遣 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遣 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遣つか－う">遣つか－う</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遣つか－わす">遣つか－わす</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遣">遣</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遣">遣</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遣">遣</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遣">遣</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遣">遣</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遣">遣</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遣">遣</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/遣">遣</a>
<span id = "number">1774</span><title>舞</title>	<p>The top two strokes show someone reclining、 and the next six are a pictograph of an oaken tub ribbed with metal strips、 like the kind once used for bathing。 At the bottom、 the sunglasses round off the character。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/舞 ぶ">ブ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/舞 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/舞 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/舞 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/舞ま－う">舞ま－う</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/舞まい">舞まい</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/舞">舞</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/舞">舞</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/舞">舞</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/舞">舞</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/舞">舞</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/舞">舞</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/舞">舞</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/舞">舞</a>
<span id = "number">1775</span><title>無</title>	<p>This character is the Japanese character for the supreme philosophical principle of much Oriental thought： nothingness。 Make use of the oaken tub from the previous frame、 and add to that the oven fire at the bottom。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/無 む">ム</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/無 ぶ">ブ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/無 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/無 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/無な－い">無な－い</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/無">無</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/無">無</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/無">無</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/無">無</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/無">無</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/無">無</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/無">無</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/無">無</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/無">無</a>
<span id = "number">1776</span><title>組</title>	<p>Thread 。 。 。 shelf。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/組 そ">ソ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/組 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/組 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/組 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/組く－む">組く－む</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/組くみ">組くみ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/組">組</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/組">組</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/組">組</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/組">組</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/組">組</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/組">組</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/組">組</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/組">組</a>

<span id = "number">1782</span><title>助</title>	<p>Shelf 。 。 。 power。 The reason why the shelf appears on the left here is that the right side is the normal position for power、 the stronger primitive。 Indeed、 the only exception in all the kanji is the character for add （frame 867 加）。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/助 じょ">ジョ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/助 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/助 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/助 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/助たす－ける">助たす－ける</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/助たす－かる">助たす－かる</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/助すけ">助すけ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/助">助</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/助">助</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/助">助</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/助">助</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/助">助</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/助">助</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/助">助</a>
<span id = "number">1783</span><title>宜</title>	<p>This kanji is a polite way of expressing one’s best regards to another。 Its elements： house 。 。 。 shelf。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/宜 ぎ">ギ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/宜 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/宜 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/宜 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/宜">宜</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/宜">宜</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/宜">宜</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/宜">宜</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/宜">宜</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/宜">宜</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/宜">宜</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/宜">宜</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/宜">宜</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/宜">宜</a>

<span id = "number">1785</span><title>並</title>	<p>This character represents a slightly stylized duplication of the kanji for stand up。 By lengthening the sixth and seventh strokes、 you will see how this is done。  The primitive meaning remains the same as that of the kanji、but special attention h...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/並 へい">ヘイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/並 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/並 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/並 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/並なみ">並なみ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/並なら－べる">並なら－べる</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/並なら－ぶ">並なら－ぶ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/並なら－びに">並なら－びに</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/並">並</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/並">並</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/並">並</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/並">並</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/並">並</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/並">並</a>

<span id = "number">1791</span><title>霊</title>	<p>Rain 。 。 。 two 。 。 。 row。 This character will refer only to the inhabitants of the “spirit world、” and not to moods or temperaments、 for which we will learn another character in frame 1885 気。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/霊 れい">レイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/霊 りょう">リョウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/霊 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/霊 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/霊たま">霊たま</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/霊">霊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/霊">霊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/霊">霊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/霊">霊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/霊">霊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/霊">霊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/霊">霊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/霊">霊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/霊">霊</a>

<span id = "number">1794</span><title>僕</title>	<p>This key word is yet another synonym for “I、” somewhat more familiar in tone。 As a rule、 it is a word that boys and men use to refer to themselves。 Its elements： person 。 。 。 husbands 。 。 。 in a row upside down。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/僕 ぼく">ボク</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/僕 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/僕 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/僕 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/僕">僕</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/僕">僕</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/僕">僕</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/僕">僕</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/僕">僕</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/僕">僕</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/僕">僕</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/僕">僕</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/僕">僕</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/僕">僕</a>
<span id = "number">1795</span><title>共</title>	<p>Salad 。 。 。 animal legs。  The primitive retains the meaning of together。Imagine things strung together like fish on a line、 beads on a thread、 or whatever。 The main thing is to avoid putting them in a straight row、 which would confound ...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/共 きょう">キョウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/共 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/共 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/共 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/共とも">共とも</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/共">共</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/共">共</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/共">共</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/共">共</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/共">共</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/共">共</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/共">共</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/共">共</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/共">共</a>
<span id = "number">1796</span><title>供</title>	<p>Submit here is a transitive verb、 meaning to off er or present。 Its elements： person 。 。 。 strung together。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/供 きょう">キョウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/供 く">ク</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/供 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/供 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/供そな－える">供そな－える</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/供とも">供とも</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/供">供</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/供">供</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/供">供</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/供">供</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/供">供</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/供">供</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/供">供</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/供">供</a>

<span id = "number">1826</span><title>冊</title>	<p>This key word is a counter for books。 It diff ers from scrapbook both in the writing order and in the extension of the second horizontal stroke。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/冊 さつ">サツ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/冊 さく">サク</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/冊 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/冊 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/冊">冊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/冊">冊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/冊">冊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/冊">冊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/冊">冊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/冊">冊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/冊">冊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/冊">冊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/冊">冊</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/冊">冊</a>
<span id = "number">1827</span><title>典</title>	<p>We introduce this character here because of its connection to the book－related kanji treated above。 It is based on the character for bend （frame 1172 曲）、 whose last stroke is lengthened to coincide with the first stroke of the element for too...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/典 てん">テン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/典 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/典 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/典 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/典">典</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/典">典</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/典">典</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/典">典</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/典">典</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/典">典</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/典">典</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/典">典</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/典">典</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/典">典</a>
