<span id = "number">1882</span><title>暇</title>	<p>The element for day on the left is logical enough。 Next to it we see staples being held in a mouth （one stroke is doubled up）、 indicating working on one’s hobby or handicraft s at home in one’s spare time。 The small box at the top right is ...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/暇 か">カ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/暇 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/暇 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/暇 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/暇ひま">暇ひま</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/暇">暇</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/暇">暇</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/暇">暇</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/暇">暇</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/暇">暇</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/暇">暇</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/暇">暇</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/暇">暇</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/暇">暇</a>
<span id = "number">1883</span><title>敷</title>	<p>At the top we have the arrowhead whose vertical line joins it to the rice field （or brains） below it。 Beneath it、 the compass； and to the right、 the taskmaster。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敷 ふ">フ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敷 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敷 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敷 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敷し－く">敷し－く</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敷">敷</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敷">敷</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敷">敷</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敷">敷</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敷">敷</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敷">敷</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敷">敷</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敷">敷</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/敷">敷</a>
<span id = "number">1884</span><title>来</title>	<p>This odd but common kanji is built up of the character for not yet into which a pair of animal horns has been inserted。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/来 らい">ライ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/来 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/来 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/来 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/来く－る">来く－る</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/来きた－る">来きた－る</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/来きた－す">来きた－す</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/来">来</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/来">来</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/来">来</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/来">来</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/来">来</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/来">来</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/来">来</a>
<span id = "number">1885</span><title>気</title>	<p>The spirit in this character refers to the changeable moods and airs of one’s personality as well as to the more essential combination of vital forces that distinguish things and individuals one from the other。 Its elements are： reclining 。 。 ...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/気 き">キ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/気 け">ケ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/気 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/気 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/気">気</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/気">気</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/気">気</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/気">気</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/気">気</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/気">気</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/気">気</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/気">気</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/気">気</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/気">気</a>
<span id = "number">1886</span><title>汽</title>	<p>Think of this character as a sibling of that for spirit。 Simply replace sheaves with drops of water on the left in order to get vapor。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/汽 き">キ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/汽 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/汽 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/汽 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/汽">汽</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/汽">汽</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/汽">汽</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/汽">汽</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/汽">汽</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/汽">汽</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/汽">汽</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/汽">汽</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/汽">汽</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/汽">汽</a>
<span id = "number">1887</span><title>飛</title>	<p>The two large hooks have little propellers （the two drops on each hook） attached to them for flying。 Beneath is the measuring box、 which serves as the body of this flying contraption。 The stroke order will cause some problems、 so take care wi...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/飛 ひ">ヒ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/飛 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/飛 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/飛 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/飛と－ぶ">飛と－ぶ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/飛と－ばす">飛と－ばす</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/飛">飛</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/飛">飛</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/飛">飛</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/飛">飛</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/飛">飛</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/飛">飛</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/飛">飛</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/飛">飛</a>
<span id = "number">1888</span><title>沈</title>	<p>The technique for sinking used in this kanji is unique。 Rather than the biblical image of tying a millstone about the victim’s neck、 here we see a crown tied about one leg before the unfortunate party is tossed into the water。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/沈 ちん">チン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/沈 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/沈 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/沈 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/沈しず－む">沈しず－む</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/沈しず－める">沈しず－める</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/沈">沈</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/沈">沈</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/沈">沈</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/沈">沈</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/沈">沈</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/沈">沈</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/沈">沈</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/沈">沈</a>
<span id = "number">1889</span><title>妻</title>	<p>Ten 。 。 。 rakes 。 。 。 woman。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妻 さい">サイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妻 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妻 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妻 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妻つま">妻つま</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妻">妻</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妻">妻</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妻">妻</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妻">妻</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妻">妻</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妻">妻</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妻">妻</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妻">妻</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/妻">妻</a>
<span id = "number">1890</span><title>衰</title>	<p>Let this key word connote the decline and fall of the Roman Empire。 It shows a fellow in a top hat and scarf、 trying hard to look happy by putting a walking stick in his mouth sideways to twist his face into a grotesque but semipermanent smile。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衰 すい">スイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衰 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衰 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衰 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衰おとろ－える">衰おとろ－える</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衰">衰</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衰">衰</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衰">衰</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衰">衰</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衰">衰</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衰">衰</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衰">衰</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衰">衰</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衰">衰</a>
<span id = "number">1891</span><title>衷</title>	<p>Between the top hat and the scarf you will see the character for in which is truncated at the bottom so as not to interfere with the scarf。 You can think of this character as forming a pair with the one just learned in the last frame： there the in ...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衷 ちゅう">チュウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衷 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衷 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衷 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衷">衷</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衷">衷</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衷">衷</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衷">衷</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衷">衷</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衷">衷</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衷">衷</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衷">衷</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衷">衷</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/衷">衷</a>
<span id = "number">1892</span><title>面</title>	<p>Imagine a mask over your head with eyes peeping not only out of the normal place、 but from all over the head、 a hundred in all （the element for eye displacing the fifth stroke of that for hundred）。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/面 めん">メン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/面 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/面 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/面 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/面おも">面おも</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/面おもて">面おもて</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/面つら">面つら</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/面">面</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/面">面</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/面">面</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/面">面</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/面">面</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/面">面</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/面">面</a>
<span id = "number">1893</span><title>革</title>	<p>After the flowers at the top （painted on the leather for decoration）、 we see the element for car with the middle stroke left out。 Think of the seats having been taken out so that they can be reupholstered with this decorated leather。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/革 かく">カク</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/革 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/革 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/革 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/革かわ">革かわ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/革">革</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/革">革</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/革">革</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/革">革</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/革">革</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/革">革</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/革">革</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/革">革</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/革">革</a>
<span id = "number">1894</span><title>靴</title>	<p>Leather 。 。 。 change。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/靴 か">カ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/靴 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/靴 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/靴 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/靴くつ">靴くつ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/靴">靴</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/靴">靴</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/靴">靴</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/靴">靴</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/靴">靴</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/靴">靴</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/靴">靴</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/靴">靴</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/靴">靴</a>
<span id = "number">1895</span><title>覇</title>	<p>Old West 。 。 。 leather 。 。 。 moon。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/覇 は">ハ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/覇 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/覇 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/覇 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/覇">覇</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/覇">覇</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/覇">覇</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/覇">覇</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/覇">覇</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/覇">覇</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/覇">覇</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/覇">覇</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/覇">覇</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/覇">覇</a>
<span id = "number">1896</span><title>声</title>	<p>The samurai at the top is familiar enough。 The combination beneath、 which looks like a flag with a line running through it、 is not。 Try to devise some way to take note of it、 and pay attention to the writing。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/声 せい">セイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/声 しょう">ショウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/声 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/声 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/声こえ">声こえ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/声こわ">声こわ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/声">声</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/声">声</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/声">声</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/声">声</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/声">声</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/声">声</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/声">声</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/声">声</a>
<span id = "number">1897</span><title>呉</title>	<p>The complex of strokes in this kanji is unusual and difficult、 because of the fourth stroke、 which is rare （see frames 33 and 34）。 The mouth and tool are already familiar。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/呉 ご">ゴ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/呉 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/呉 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/呉 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/呉">呉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/呉">呉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/呉">呉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/呉">呉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/呉">呉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/呉">呉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/呉">呉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/呉">呉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/呉">呉</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/呉">呉</a>
<span id = "number">1898</span><title>娯</title>	<p>Woman 。 。 。 give。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/娯 ご">ゴ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/娯 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/娯 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/娯 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/娯">娯</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/娯">娯</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/娯">娯</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/娯">娯</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/娯">娯</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/娯">娯</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/娯">娯</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/娯">娯</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/娯">娯</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/娯">娯</a>
<span id = "number">1899</span><title>誤</title>	<p>Words 。 。 。 give。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/誤 ご">ゴ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/誤 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/誤 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/誤 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/誤あやま－る">誤あやま－る</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/誤">誤</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/誤">誤</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/誤">誤</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/誤">誤</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/誤">誤</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/誤">誤</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/誤">誤</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/誤">誤</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/誤">誤</a>
<span id = "number">1900</span><title>蒸</title>	<p>The flower at the top and the  with the oven fire beneath are familiar。 The problem is what comes in between。 It is formed by the character for complete、 whose vertical stroke doubles up as the first stroke of water。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/蒸 じょう">ジョウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/蒸 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/蒸 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/蒸 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/蒸む－す">蒸む－す</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/蒸む－れる">蒸む－れる</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/蒸む－らす">蒸む－らす</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/蒸">蒸</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/蒸">蒸</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/蒸">蒸</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/蒸">蒸</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/蒸">蒸</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/蒸">蒸</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/蒸">蒸</a>
<span id = "number">1901</span><title>承</title>	<p>The sense of passive acceptance or reception of information is contained in this key word。 The form is based on the middle portion of the preceding character、 with three additional strokes、 best thought of as the kanji for three。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/承 しょう">ショウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/承 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/承 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/承 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/承うけたまわ－る">承うけたまわ－る</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/承">承</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/承">承</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/承">承</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/承">承</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/承">承</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/承">承</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/承">承</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/承">承</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/承">承</a>
<span id = "number">1902</span><title>函</title>	<p>This is the character from which the element for shovel derives。 Within it comes the element for snare、 with the sparkler surrounding it。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/函 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/函 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/函 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/函 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/函">函</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/函">函</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/函">函</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/函">函</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/函">函</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/函">函</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/函">函</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/函">函</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/函">函</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/函">函</a>
<span id = "number">1903</span><title>極</title>	<p>The poles this key word refers to are the extremities of the earth or the terminals of an electric field。 The elements are： tree 。 。 。 snare 。 。 。 mouth 。 。 。 crotch 。 。 。 。 </p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/極 きょく">キョク</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/極 ごく">ゴク</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/極 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/極 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/極きわ－める">極きわ－める</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/極きわ－まる">極きわ－まる</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/極きわ－み">極きわ－み</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/極">極</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/極">極</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/極">極</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/極">極</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/極">極</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/極">極</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/極">極</a>
<span id = "number">1904</span><title>牙</title>	<p>If you play with this primitive’s form with pencil and paper、 you will see that it begins with a box－like shape、 and ends with the final two strokes of the halberd、 a convenient combination for the tusk protruding from the mouth of an animal。...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/牙 が">ガ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/牙 げ">ゲ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/牙 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/牙 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/牙きば">牙きば</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/牙">牙</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/牙">牙</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/牙">牙</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/牙">牙</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/牙">牙</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/牙">牙</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/牙">牙</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/牙">牙</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/牙">牙</a>

<span id = "number">1909</span><title>番</title>	<p>This key word has been chosen for its overlay of several meanings similar to those of the kanji： a turn of duty、 a round、 a number、 and so forth。 Its composite elements： animal tracks 。 。 。 rice field。  As a primitive element、 we ch...</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/番 ばん">バン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/番 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/番 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/番 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/番">番</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/番">番</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/番">番</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/番">番</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/番">番</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/番">番</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/番">番</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/番">番</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/番">番</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/番">番</a>

<span id = "number">1913</span><title>毛</title>	<p>This character simply reverses the direction of the final stroke of hand to produce fur。 If you reverse your hand and put its palm down、 you will have the side on which fur grows。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/毛 もう">モウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/毛 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/毛 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/毛 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/毛け">毛け</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/毛">毛</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/毛">毛</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/毛">毛</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/毛">毛</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/毛">毛</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/毛">毛</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/毛">毛</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/毛">毛</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/毛">毛</a>

<span id = "number">1918</span><title>為</title>	<p>This character rightly belongs to the previous lesson、 but we held it until now because of the final element、 the tail feathers。 After the drop at the outset、 the next three strokes are completely novel and should be given special attention。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/為 い">イ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/為 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/為 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/為 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/為">為</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/為">為</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/為">為</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/為">為</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/為">為</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/為">為</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/為">為</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/為">為</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/為">為</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/為">為</a>

<span id = "number">1944</span><title>烏</title>	<p>The only thing that distinguishes this character from that for bird is the omission of the one stroke that makes it white。 Which is logical enough、 when you consider that there are no crows of that color。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/烏 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/烏 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/烏 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/烏 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/烏">烏</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/烏">烏</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/烏">烏</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/烏">烏</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/烏">烏</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/烏">烏</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/烏">烏</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/烏">烏</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/烏">烏</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/烏">烏</a>

<span id = "number">1948</span><title>島</title>	<p>The bird’s tail is tucked under here、 because it has come to stop on a mountain to rest from its journey across the waters。 Thus the kanji comes to mean an island。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/島 とう">トウ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/島 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/島 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/島 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/島しま">島しま</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/島">島</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/島">島</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/島">島</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/島">島</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/島">島</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/島">島</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/島">島</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/島">島</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/島">島</a>
<span id = "number">1949</span><title>暖</title>	<p>Unlike the connotation of warm weather learned for an earlier key word、 （frame 1452 温）、 this key word will be used to refer to the warmth of human congeniality。 Its elements are： sun 。 。 。 migrating ducks。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/暖 だん">ダン</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/暖 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/暖 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/暖 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/暖あたた－か">暖あたた－か</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/暖あたた－かい">暖あたた－かい</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/暖あたた－まる">暖あたた－まる</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/暖あたた－める">暖あたた－める</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/暖">暖</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/暖">暖</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/暖">暖</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/暖">暖</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/暖">暖</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/暖">暖</a>

<span id = "number">2001</span><title>慶</title>	<p>Deer 。 。 。 crown （note the doubling up） 。 。 。 heart 。 。 。 walking legs。 You may recall that we met the relative primitives at the bottom here before、 in the kanji for melancholy （frame 616 憂）。</p><br><br><title>Onyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/慶 けい">ケイ</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/慶 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/慶 "></a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/慶 "></a><br><br><title>Kunyomi</title><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/慶">慶</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/慶">慶</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/慶">慶</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/慶">慶</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/慶">慶</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/慶">慶</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/慶">慶</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/慶">慶</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/慶">慶</a><a href = "https://www.jisho.org/search/慶">慶</a>
